### 11. Voting / Decision-Making
- The Council's decisions regarding matters related to the Initiative's strategies and policies shall be taken by consensus.
- Regarding decisions specific to activities and projects presented to the Council, decisions shall be taken by majority vote.
- In the event of a tie, the President's vote shall be the casting vote.

### 12. Frequency of Meetings
- The Ministerial Council shall hold at least one meeting annually. The President of the Council may call for additional meetings when necessary.
- The country presiding over the Council shall host Council meetings for a full year, while the country hosting the Council meeting in the following year shall submit a proposal
- for the meeting formats (virtual / in-person / hybrid) and their timings, at the last Ministerial Council meeting.
- In the event that the country holding the Council's presidency is unable to host a Council meeting, and in consultation with the Initiative's Secretariat and the Ministerial Council, and in the event that
- the previous presidency, in consultation with the Initiative's Secretariat and the Ministerial Council, and in the event that the country holding the Council's presidency is unable to host a Council meeting
- of the Ministerial Council, the meeting shall in this case be held in the host country.

## The Executive Committee

### 13. Role and Responsibilities
- The Executive Committee is the body responsible for making the Initiative's operational decisions. The Executive Committee undertakes the task of approving the operational plans
- for the Initiative's strategies, policies, and plans adopted by the Ministerial Council. The Committee reviews and endorses projects and funding allocations and submits them to
- the Ministerial Council for approval. The Committee also approves technical support activity plans.
- The Executive Committee is responsible for approving and endorsing proposed policies to be presented to the Ministerial Council regarding matters falling within
- its responsibilities. The Committee may form sub-committees to assist the Executive Committee in performing its duties.

### 14. Committee Membership
- The Executive Committee shall consist of Undersecretaries from all member states in the region, who are decision-makers at the same level from national entities
- whose responsibilities include environment, forestry, agriculture, climate, land degradation, or related responsibilities.
- The Committee may invite representatives from contributors to the Initiative's activities and projects from outside the region, international organizations, multilateral development banks,
- and private sector organizations to participate in its meetings in an advisory capacity.
- The Executive Committee shall be chaired by a representative from the same member country that presides over the Ministerial Council.

### 15. Voting / Decision-Making
- The Committee's decisions regarding matters related to the Initiative's strategies and policies shall be taken by consensus. Regarding decisions specific to activities and projects,
- decisions shall be taken by majority vote. In the event of a tie, the Committee Chairman's vote shall be the casting vote for all votes.

### 16. Frequency of Meetings
- The Executive Committee shall meet at least twice annually. Additional meetings may be held when necessary. The Chairman of the Executive Committee must
- notify members at least 6 weeks prior to the meeting date and provide necessary documents to members, in coordination with the Initiative's Secretary-General.
- Meetings shall coincide with Ministerial Council meetings. The country holding the Executive Committee's presidency shall host for a full year. Should it be impossible for
- the country holding the Committee's presidency to host Executive Committee meetings, the meetings shall in this case be held in the Secretariat's host country.

# The Initiative's General Secretariat
## 17. Role and Responsibilities
The General Secretariat provides support to the Initiative in areas related to facilitating the meetings of the Ministerial Council, the Executive Committee, and the Scientific Advisory Committee, in addition to supporting all activities and events of the sub-committees established by the Executive Committee. The Initiative's Secretariat prepares proposals regarding operational and strategic policies and guidelines to be submitted to the Executive Committee and/or the Ministerial Council for adoption as required by the situation. The General Secretariat performs, but is not limited to, the following tasks:
- Organizing / facilitating knowledge exchange activities such as scientific conferences, technical workshops, and visits related to scientific and research fields, and establishing digital platforms for exchanging information and data on projects sponsored by the Initiative.
- Supporting capacity-building activities for human and institutional resources, including training courses and providing / facilitating consultations for institutional development, establishing regulatory frameworks, technology transfer, and other enabling elements related to the restoration and preservation of degraded lands.
- Monitoring and evaluating activities and projects aimed at restoring and preserving degraded lands, supported by the Initiative, and reporting on the progress made in project implementation and the overall operation of the Initiative's activities.
- Assisting in coordinating national initiatives across member states in the region to enhance the cycle of environmental initiatives across the region.
- Providing or facilitating technical expertise and consultations on the selection, design, and implementation of Initiative-related activities, or any of these steps.
- Providing or facilitating technical support in project selection, scope definition, design, crystallization, implementation, results monitoring, and external reporting.
- Following up on the implementation of decisions by the Ministerial Council and the Executive Committee.
- Playing a key role in communicating for partnerships with the private sector, and a leading role in some activities such as issuing green accreditations, supporting program design, and negotiating with potential investors.
- Engaging countries from outside the region to maximize support for the Initiative.

## 18. Selection of the Work Team and Human Resources
- The Initiative's General Secretariat consists of a dedicated, full-time work team comprising specialists in multiple disciplines according to its tasks. The General Secretariat may appoint part-time employees and reinforce the work team with individuals from outside the Kingdom if the need arises.
- The General Secretariat is headed by a Secretary-General nominated by the Executive Committee and approved by the Ministerial Council. The Secretary-General's term of office extends for three years, and the Executive Committee may nominate them for a second term, subject to the approval of the Ministerial Council.
- The Secretary-General and senior staff of the General Secretariat enjoy diplomatic status, provided that the Secretary-General nominates the employees who will enjoy this diplomatic status and submits their names to the Executive Committee for approval.

## 19. Headquarters and Budget of the General Secretariat
The permanent headquarters of the General Secretariat is located in Riyadh <orig>الرياض</orig>, the capital of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia <orig>المملكة العربية السعودية</orig>. The General Secretariat may propose the establishment of regional offices for the Initiative as deemed necessary by the Executive Committee to accomplish the work, subject to the approval of the Ministerial Council. The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia <orig>المملكة العربية السعودية</orig> shall provide the building that will house the General Secretariat and cover its operational budget for ten years starting from the fiscal year 2023.

## 20. Working Language
The General Secretariat conducts all its work in both Arabic and English as its official languages. Initiative documents may be translated into French as needed.

### The Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig>
21. The Middle East Green Initiative <orig>مبادرة الشرق الأوسط الأخضر</orig> shall establish a fund to contribute to providing financial support for its activities and projects implemented in member states. The Fund may receive voluntary financial contributions from member states or from non-member states, or from regional and international institutions and organizations, or regional and international private institutions, or individuals or charitable organizations. Or from the financial return from investing the assets of the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> deposited in another source of funds approved by the Ministerial Council.
22. The Initiative's Founding Task Force shall define the guiding framework for the Initiative's financial contributions from non-state contributors.

### 23. Role and Responsibilities:
- The Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> shall oversee financial assets, receive funds from donors, and disburse them for projects/activities upon authorization.
- And prepare reports regarding the Initiative's financial affairs.

### 24. Management of the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig>
- The Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> shall be managed by a specialized international organization/multilateral development bank under a trust arrangement, whereby the organization/bank shall be an independent trustee partner for the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> to ensure the implementation of robust financial mechanisms in line with international best practices.
- The interim Founding Task Force shall prepare the role of the external trustee for the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> and present it to the Executive Committee and then to the Ministerial Council for adoption and approval.

### 25. Steering Committee of the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig>
- A dedicated Steering Committee for the Fund shall unanimously determine the total annual amount to be allocated from the available funds in the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> for disbursement on the Initiative's projects and activities.
- The Ministerial Council shall establish procedures for adopting decisions in the Fund's Steering Committee in the event that all efforts to reach a consensus are exhausted.
- Disbursement of funds for projects requires the approval of the Executive Committee.
- The Fund's Secretariat shall not participate in decisions related to the allocation of funds at the project level, but rather undertakes a fiduciary duty to report any inappropriate use of funds.

### 26. Membership of the Steering Committee of the Initiative Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig>
- The Committee shall consist of representatives of states that have pledged financial contributions from within and outside the region.
- The interim Founding Task Force shall propose the minimum qualifying contribution for Committee membership and the powers of state and non-state contributors, and submit them to the Executive Committee and then to the Ministerial Council for adoption and approval.

### The Scientific Advisory Committee
### 27. Role and Responsibilities
- The Scientific Advisory Committee shall provide non-binding advice to the Ministerial Council, the Executive Committee, or the Initiative's General Secretariat when requested.
- It shall provide knowledge exchange facilities and activities, and prepare reviews of strategies, policies, projects, and other matters referred to it by the Initiative's regional administrative bodies.
- The Committee shall publish technical reports or research papers as requested by it or by the aforementioned administrative bodies.

### 28. Committee Membership
- The Committee shall consist of a group of specialized experts from relevant international organizations, regional organizations, and internationally/regionally renowned experts in technical affairs and policy-related matters within the scope of the Initiative's work.
- Members may be nominated to participate in the Committee by member states or by regional/international organizations, subject to the approval of the Executive Committee.

### 29. The General Secretariat
- The Initiative's General Secretariat shall provide administrative and technical support to the Ministerial Council, the Executive Committee, or the Initiative's General Secretariat when requested.
- The Initiative's General Secretariat shall prepare reviews of strategies, policies, projects, and other matters referred to it by the Initiative's regional administrative bodies.

## National Contact Points
### 29. Role and Responsibilities

*   In addition to the five main entities managing the Initiative's activities at the regional level, each member state shall designate a national contact point to communicate with the Initiative's General Secretariat.
*   This contact point serves as a link between national governments and the Initiative's regional administrative bodies, facilitating the exchange of information regarding activities supported by the Initiative.
*   National contact points are responsible for identifying national activity projects that will be submitted to the Initiative for financial and/or technical support. They are also responsible for establishing and managing relationships with partner implementing entities, supporting project implementation, and preparing and submitting progress reports to the Initiative's General Secretariat.

### 30. National Coordination

*   The Initiative encourages member states to establish an internal mechanism to facilitate national oversight and coordination of regional efforts related to projects/activities supported by the Initiative and hosted by the country. Membership in the national coordination mechanism shall consist of representatives from various national entities across different disciplines to ensure integration and cooperation among various specializations in the selection and implementation of projects/activities supported by the Initiative at the national level.
*   The Initiative's Secretariat, upon request from member states, may provide or facilitate advice on establishing a national coordination mechanism within the country in accordance with best practices.

## Activation of the Initiative's Regional Governmental Charter
31. Following the adoption of the Initiative's Charter at the Ministerial Meeting held on October 26, 2022, and its endorsement by leaders at the Second Initiative Summit in November 2022, the Founding States are invited to ratify the Initiative's governance framework and nominate their representatives to the Initiative's Ministerial Council and Executive Committee. This is preferably to be done before the end of January 2023, to activate the Initiative's regional governance and provide strategic guidance and oversight for the commencement of the Initiative's work and operations. The Founding States refer to the countries in the region that participated in the Ministerial Meeting held on October 26, 2022, and approved the Initiative's Charter. Other countries in the region, as defined in paragraph six (6), will be invited later to encourage their joining the Initiative.

32. Following the establishment of the Initiative's Ministerial Council and Executive Committee, a provisional founding task force will be formed. This task force will manage the process of nominating the Initiative's Secretary-General and establishing the General Secretariat under the supervision of the Executive Committee.

33. The provisional founding task force shall consist of representatives from the Founding Member States within the region. These states may decide to participate in the task force on a voluntary basis, provided they bear the responsibilities and possess the expertise related to the Initiative's establishment process. It should be noted that any non-founding state that joins the Initiative's membership during the provisional founding task force's operational period will have its representatives included as members of the task force. The task force may utilize the support of specialized advisory organizations during the performance of its duties.

34. The Founding Working Group <orig>فريق العمل التأسيسي</orig> and the Initiative's General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة للمبادرة</orig>, after its establishment, shall undertake the process of detailing the aforementioned governance framework. Section (7) of this document outlines the detailed activities expected to be carried out during implementation.
35. The Founding Working Group <orig>فريق العمل التأسيسي</orig> shall continue its work until the establishment of the Initiative's General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة للمبادرة</orig>. Upon its establishment, the Founding Working Group <orig>فريق العمل التأسيسي</orig> shall be dissolved by the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig>.

## Project and Activity Funding

36. Within its mandate and the provision of financial resources, the Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig> aims to provide support for the Initiative's projects and activities hosted by member states, and to explore all avenues to attract strong international support for the Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig>, facilitate regional participation and cooperation, and support effective implementation with the goal of reducing environmental degradation and working to restore degraded lands, or aiming to enhance the conservation and sustainable management of natural land resources, or both.
37. The Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig> will work to provide financial resources for projects and activities from the Initiative's Fund <orig>صندوق المبادرة</orig> and from other funding sources, through joint funding mechanisms that include national funding and contributions from international organizations and the private sector, to enable it to provide the greatest possible support for efforts to restore and conserve degraded lands.
*   Defining the principles of approval, evaluation, and the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig> for classifying, selecting, funding, and tracking the progress of projects, and presenting them to the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig> for approval.
*   Member states shall submit project proposals to the Initiative's General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة للمبادرة</orig> through their respective National Focal Point <orig>جهة الاتصال الوطنية</orig> according to the specified criteria mentioned above, provided that the General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> in turn presents a proposed decision for the executive projects for review and then presents it to the Ministerial Council <orig>المجلس الوزاري</orig> for approval. Multiple National Focal Points <orig>جهات الاتصال الوطنية</orig> can collaborate in preparing regional projects subject to joint development.
*   The Founding Working Group <orig>فريق العمل التأسيسي</orig> is responsible for preparing the temporary working group for the forms related to submitting regional projects, subject to the approval of the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig>.

38. The Fund's Steering Committee <orig>اللجنة التوجيهية للصندوق</orig> shall unanimously determine the annual budget allocated for projects and activities supported by the Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig>.

## Monitoring, Reporting, and Evaluation

39. In order to maintain the effectiveness, efficiency, and impact of the Initiative's activities and ensure their alignment with the Initiative's objectives, the General Secretariat of the Initiative <orig>الأمانة العامة للمبادرة</orig> will include a Monitoring and Evaluation Unit <orig>وحدة للمتابعة والتقييم</orig> responsible for developing guidelines and methodologies for monitoring, reporting on, and evaluating the activities of projects supported by the Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig>, in addition to supporting the implementation of these principles and methodologies. The Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> shall oversee the preparation and evaluation of reports from member states and stakeholders in line with its guidelines. The Initiative's Secretariat <orig>أمانة المبادرة</orig> may seek the services of specialized external entities for monitoring, evaluation, and other matters.
40. The Founding Working Group <orig>فريق العمل التأسيسي</orig> shall prepare monitoring and evaluation forms to be used after the Executive Committee's <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig> approval of these forms.
41. At the national level: For individual projects supported by the Initiative <orig>المبادرة</orig>, this will be agreed upon during the project approval process as appropriate. National Focal Points <orig>جهات الاتصال الوطنية</orig> are responsible for collecting data from relevant national entities, preparing specific periodic reports, and submitting them to the Initiative's Secretariat <orig>أمانة المبادرة</orig>.
42. At the regional level: The Initiative's Secretariat <orig>أمانة المبادرة</orig> is responsible for utilizing periodic bulletins that specify their submission periods to the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig> and include the latest updates on the progress of the Initiative's projects and activities and their financial performance, provided that they are reviewed and approved by the Executive Committee <orig>اللجنة التنفيذية</orig> before publication. Furthermore, the General Secretariat of the Initiative <orig>الأمانة العامة للمبادرة</orig> shall prepare a summary of the progress report to be submitted to the Ministerial Council <orig>المجلس الوزاري</orig> at its periodic meetings.

## Membership
### Founding Member States
44. The states listed in Annex No. 2, which approved the Initiative's Charter during the Ministerial Meeting held on October 26, 2022, are considered founding members of the Initiative.

### Eligibility of Other States for Membership
45. States eligible for membership in the Initiative are divided into two categories:
- Regional Members: These are states located within the geographical scope of the Initiative, which includes Central, West, and South Asia, North Africa, and also Sub-Saharan Africa.
- Non-Regional Contributors: These are states located outside the geographical scope of the Initiative.
46. The Initiative aims to add new members from states both within and outside the region to join either as a member or an observer member after their approval within the Initiative. These states may join the Initiative as a member by ratifying or acceding to the Charter.
47. The admission of new members (non-founding) is subject to the unanimous approval of the Initiative's Ministerial Council.

### Withdrawal of Member States
48. Any member state has the right to withdraw from the Initiative by submitting a formal notice of withdrawal to the Secretary-General of the Initiative at least twelve months prior to the date of withdrawal. This notice shall be communicated to all member states through the Initiative's Secretariat.
49. If a member state chooses to withdraw from the Initiative, any Initiative project activities taking place in that state will be terminated as agreed in the project.

### Contributions of Regional Members
50. All contributions from member states to the Initiative are voluntary, and members from within the region may contribute in one or more of the following ways:

a) **Policy Alignment with the Initiative's Objectives**
- Encouraging member states to follow the following policy provisions to build a foundation for successful, large-scale implementation of the Initiative:
- Publicly declaring participation in and support for the Initiative.
- Declaring national environmental targets for combating land degradation and restoring or increasing vegetation cover.
- Encouraging policies aimed at minimizing land degradation, maximizing the conservation of terrestrial ecosystems, and increasing local community participation in ecosystem preservation.

b) **Encouraging Project Implementation**
- The Initiative encourages its members from within the region to:
- Submit project proposals to the Initiative's General Secretariat, host Initiative-sponsored projects under state supervision, and encourage their implementation.
- Initiate national projects that align with the Initiative's scope and objectives.

c) **Financial Contributions**
- Voluntarily provide financial contributions to the Initiative's fund.

Depository for the Initiative's Charter
03. Once the Initiative's General Secretariat is established, it shall serve as the depository for this Charter and the membership documents of states. The Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture <orig>وزارة البيئة والمياه والزراعة</orig> in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia <orig>المملكة العربية السعودية</orig> shall temporarily hold the Charter, after its adoption by the Ministerial Meeting held on October 26, 2022, until the establishment of the Initiative's General Secretariat.
Amendment of the Charter
04. The Initiative's Charter may be amended through a request submitted by one or more member states from within the region or by the Secretary-General. The amendment requires the unanimous vote of the Executive Committee members and unanimous approval by the Initiative's Ministerial Council. Amendment requests shall only be accepted after one month from the approval of the initial Charter at the Ministerial Meeting held on October 26, 2022.
Establishment and Operation of the Initiative
05. The remaining foundational steps for implementing the Initiative shall be carried out in two phases as detailed below:
*   Phase One will focus on establishing the Initiative's General Secretariat, which will be undertaken by the Foundational Working Group.
*   Phase Two will focus on enhancing the development of administrative bodies and their authorities, and automating the Initiative.
06. Upon the establishment of the Ministerial Council and the Executive Committee during the first quarter of 2023, the Foundational Working Group will be formed. Founding partner states are requested to voluntarily select and nominate representatives to the Working Group and submit their names as soon as possible, following the adoption of the Initiative's governance by the Executive Committee in November 2022. The Foundational Working Group will meet periodically whenever possible, either in person in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia <orig>المملكة العربية السعودية</orig> or through virtual meetings, to complete the tasks assigned to it within the specified timeframe.
Phase One
07. The Foundational Working Group shall undertake the following tasks, focusing on the operation of the Initiative's General Secretariat and establishing a basis for the Initiative's fund under the supervision and approval of the Executive Committee, and in line with the Initiative's Charter and the governance structure detailed in Section Two.
*   Establishing criteria for selecting candidates for the Initiative's General Secretariat and selecting its leadership, subject to the Executive Committee's approval, and in line with the Initiative's Charter and governance structure.
*   Preparing the details of the initial organizational structure for the Initiative's General Secretariat.
*   Defining the necessary operations, regulations, and guidelines to enable the operation of the Initiative's General Secretariat.
*   Preparing details of internal governance policies and decision-making policies within the Initiative's General Secretariat.
*   Developing a competitive salary structure with the aim of attracting regional and international competencies to fill full-time positions within the Initiative's General Secretariat.
*   Developing an initial proposal for the Initiative's fund and its treasurer.
08. The first meeting of the Executive Committee shall be held after its establishment during the first quarter of 2023, to nominate a candidate for the position of Secretary-General and present the proposal to the Ministerial Council for approval.
09. The primary role of the Secretary-General is to establish the Initiative's General Secretariat and outline the necessary steps for its operation. The Secretary-General and their team will work with the Foundational Working Group to develop the detailed design of the targeted organizational structure. They will be responsible for developing the initial design of the organizational structure, operations, salary structure, and other components specific to the Initiative's General Secretariat, subject to the Executive Committee's approval of the foregoing.

10. The Founding Working Group is working on establishing the General Secretariat of the Initiative as part of the first phase. Once the Secretariat is established, the Founding Working Group will be dissolved by the Executive Committee.

## Phase Two
11. The General Secretariat of the Initiative, once established, shall undertake its operations within the scope of its powers, preferably before the end of the third quarter of 2023.
12. The Secretariat, under the direction of the Ministerial Council and the Executive Committee, shall undertake the following tasks, with a focus on completing the institutional and legal formation of the Initiative:
    - Appointing the necessary staff to expand the scope of the General Secretariat's operations.
    - Establishing the Initiative's Fund and appointing a Treasurer.
    - Finalizing the Initiative's operating model, operations, regulations, and guiding principles to activate all administrative bodies.
    - Finalizing the internal governance policies and decision-making policies for the Initiative's administrative bodies.
    - Finalizing the organizational structure and operations for the Initiative's administrative bodies, including mechanisms and procedures for cooperation between the Secretariat and national focal points in member states.
    - Developing financial plans and budgets to ensure the Initiative's financial continuity and sustainability.
    - Finalizing the formation of all administrative bodies affiliated with the Initiative, including the Scientific Advisory Committee and the Fund Steering Committee, upon the recommendation of the Ministerial Council and the Executive Committee.
    - Launching a series of pilot projects and activities.
13. Phase Two shall continue until the Initiative is fully operational within the scope of its work and tasks.

### Ministerial Decision No. (9) of 2025
### Regarding the Registration of Dasman Palace <orig>قصر دسمان</orig> Historical Site

Minister of Information and Culture <orig>وزير الإعلام والثقافة</orig> and Minister of State for Youth Affairs <orig>وزير الدولة لشئون الشباب</orig>
Chairman of the National Council for Culture, Arts and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>

## Head of Bankruptcy Department
In the Name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
General Court
Bankruptcy Department
## Decision
On Thursday, 3/6/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department, in the presence of Mr. Zaid Abdulhadi Al-Attar <orig>زيد عبدالهادي العطار</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge, and in the presence of Mr. Yousef Al-Baker <orig>يوسف البكر</orig>, Secretary.
Regarding Application No.: (2023/1) (Restructuring), registered under automated number: 230244220, submitted by: Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> against: Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
And regarding Application No.: (2023/241) (Declaration of Bankruptcy), registered under automated number: 234150250, submitted by the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> against: Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>.
And regarding Application No.: (2024/18) (Declaration of Bankruptcy), registered under automated number: 240342590, submitted by: Gulf Insurance Group <orig>مجموعة الخليج للتأمين</orig> against: Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>.
After reviewing the documents and the memorandum submitted by Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> on 3/11/2024, requesting approval of the restructuring plan based on Article (124) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its executive regulations:
The facts are summarized in the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge in the present application, issued on 4/11/2024, which instructed the Bankruptcy Department to notify the debtor and all creditors, in addition to the Bankruptcy Committee and the supervisory authority (Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>), with a copy of the Secretary's letter dated 24/10/2024 regarding the meeting of Aman Takaful Insurance Company's <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> creditors and its attachments, for them to submit their objections within ten days, to which it refers for remembrance.
We summarize, to the extent necessary to connect their descriptions, that on 19/1/2023, Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> submitted Application No. (2023/1) (Restructuring) to initiate its restructuring procedures due to its cessation of payments and deficit in its financial position. The amount of debt it ceased to pay or is expected to cease paying amounts to (6,844,870 KWD <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Its application was supported by a receipt for the application fee, a copy of a certificate issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, a special power of attorney, and two folders of documents including: Aman Takaful Insurance Company's <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> restructuring business plan, a statement of the company's employees' data, contracts for legal fees, services, and legal consultations, case follow-up, a nomination letter for Eid Salman Matar Al-Shammari <orig>عيد سلمان مطر الشمري</orig> as a trustee for the company according to the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, a license issued by the Public Shareholding Companies Department <orig>إدارة الشركات المساهمة</orig> stating that the legal entity of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> is a closed joint-stock company, the company's consolidated financial data for the fiscal years (2019, 2020, 2021), a notification issued by the judicial inquiry regarding unenforced judgments, and two statements issued by the Legal Department concerning ongoing disputes in cases filed by and against the company in the courts. It also attached an explanatory memorandum for its application and a summary of the company's current economic situation, requesting at its conclusion approval to initiate the company's restructuring based on the fact that Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> (the applicant company) has been operating in the insurance sector since 2013. By the end of 2019, the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> refrained from renewing its operating license, leading the company to cease operations at the beginning of 2020, passing through the Corona crisis and the transfer of the insurance sector's affiliation from the Ministry to the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>. The Unit did not grant the company an operating license despite it fulfilling all conditions until June/2021, six months after submitting its application. Twenty days after that, the Unit registered the guarantee deposit for the company's operations and all creditors in favor of a single enforcement file, despite the company's commitment to all its debts within ninety days from the date of the operating license and what Article (87) of the Insurance Law <orig>قانون التأمين</orig> stipulated, that existing insurance and reinsurance companies, upon the enactment of this law, must regularize their status in accordance with its provisions within one year from the date of publication of the executive regulations, which were published in March/2021. Accordingly, the applicant company submitted a request to the Enforcement Judge <orig>قاضي التنفيذ</orig> for installment payments in the enforcement files and to make settlements and payments to policyholders. However, on 7/12/2021, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> warned the company to address the mentioned violations, only to issue Decision No. (2021/45) to suspend the company's operations two days after the warning. This prompted the company to appeal the decision before the Grievance Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig>. On 1/2/2022, the Committee issued its decision to cancel the Insurance Unit's decision for violating the law. On 13/6/2022, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> issued a decision to fine the company an amount of (10,000 KWD <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) due to the deposit registration. The company did not accept this decision and appealed it before the Grievance Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig>, which issued its decision to cancel the decision.
<page_end>130</page_end>

<header>
131
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1731, Seventy-First Year

</header>
The representative of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> submitted a letter in which it reserved its right not to approve the restructuring request submitted by the applicant company, and proposed the appointment of Ernst & Young Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>ارنست اند ويونغ العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم</orig> as trustee and Crowe Al-Muhanna & Partners <orig>كرو المهنا وشركاه</orig> as inspector in the present request, should their appointment be decided according to the law.

The facts of Request No. (241/2023 Bankruptcy Declaration) are that on 10/12/2023, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> submitted a request to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings against the company due to its cessation of payments and deficit in its financial position. The amount of debt it ceased to pay or is expected to cease paying amounts to (6,844,870 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>). The request was supported by a portfolio of documents including a copy of a commercial license, declarations, undertakings, letters, correspondences, a balance sheet, a statement, a judgment enforcement report, a notice from the Unit to the company against which the request was filed, and the latter's response to the notice. The applicant also attached an explanatory memorandum for its request and a summary of the company's current economic situation, concluding by requesting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration proceedings against it, the transfer of all valid documents issued in the name of the company against which the request was filed to another licensed and approved company by the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and the appointment of Ernst & Young Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>ارنست ويونغ العيبان والعصيمي شركاهم</orig> as trustee of the bankruptcy estate in accordance with Article (20) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.

The facts of Request No. (18/2024 Bankruptcy Declaration) are that on 28/1/2024, Gulf Insurance Group <orig>مجموعة الخليج للتأمين</orig> submitted a request to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings against the company due to its cessation of payments and deficit in its financial position. The amount of debt it ceased to pay or is expected to cease paying amounts to (264,478.299 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>). The request was supported by a receipt for the application fee and two portfolios of documents including copies of judicial judgments, warnings, printouts showing the value of judgments for enforcement files, a statement of cases registered by and against the company against which the request was filed, and a certificate issued by the Commercial Register Department <orig>إدارة السجل التجاري</orig>.

On 4/3/2024, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> decided to consolidate requests Nos. (1/2023 Restructuring, 241/2023, 18/2024 Bankruptcy Declaration) to take collective action on them, in accordance with Article (17) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.

On the same date, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to accept the request and initiate the penalty procedures, considering it null and void due to its conflict with the law. The Unit also issued its decision No. (2022/16) to suspend the applicant company from work for the aforementioned violations, one month before the end of the second extension period for implementing Article (87) of the Insurance Law <orig>قانون التأمين</orig>. The company appealed this decision, and the appeal is still pending before the Grievance Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig>. Since the applicant company has suffered from regulatory bodies, starting from the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> and ending with the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, through multiple suspensions, obstacles placed in the way of its plans, and restrictions imposed on it, and they did not provide assistance to overcome its crisis and promote it and the insurance sector, these suspensions and the Corona crisis had a profound impact on the company and the sector in terms of debts and obligations towards creditors, rendering it unable to settle these obligations despite its capabilities that could help it settle and achieve financial surpluses within a few years. The company had faced some financial difficulties during the past period due to repeated suspensions by the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, which negatively affected the company's cash flows and harmed the rights of shareholders and policyholders, as the company currently has no cash liquidity due to the long period of suspension from 24/8/2022 until now, and it is settling its obligations from its monthly operating expenses, which prompted the company to submit its current request.

The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> reviewed the request as stated in the session minutes, where the applicant company was represented by its lawyer who submitted a portfolio of documents, unsegregated documents, and explanatory memoranda for the request, which were reviewed and understood. A representative of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> also attended and submitted two portfolios of documents and two memoranda in which he argued for the inadmissibility of the request submitted by the applicant company in form due to the Unit not being notified in accordance with Article (3) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, in addition to requesting its substantive rejection.

On 2/11/2023, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> decided to enclose the bankruptcy request with the present restructuring request and its attachments, provided that the Committee informs the Department of its opinion on the matter, along with the nomination of the trustee and the estimation of their fees if their appointment is decided according to the law.

In implementation of this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its report No. (59) dated 20/12/2023, concluding with the opinion to accept the plan, appoint Mr. Eid Salman Al-Rashidi <orig>السيد/ عيد سلمان الرشيدي</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors of Insurance, as trustee, and the submitted nomination letter due to his experience in the insurance field, and appoint an inspector from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to monitor the trustee's implementation of the plan and establish a mechanism for monitoring creditors and the trustee and the reports submitted regarding its implementation, the deadlines for submitting these reports, and their content, and to estimate the trustee's fees at a monthly salary of (1000 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>), and the inspector's fee at (2000 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>) for two years, with a legal grace period according to the judge's discretion to review the company's ability to implement the restructuring plan based on the inspector's report.

</header>
restructuring of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, setting 19/1/2023 as a temporary date for suspension of payments, and appointing a trustee to inventory the assets and properties of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, prepare an updated financial position and a list of debts, a restructuring plan, and a monthly report on the progress of the plan, and take all necessary precautionary measures. This also includes appointing a supervisor to monitor the trustee's implementation of Aman Takaful Insurance Company's <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> restructuring plan, establish a mechanism for monitoring creditors and the trustee, and prepare a monthly report on the progress of procedures.

On 15/5/2024, the bankruptcy judge issued a decision affirming Aman Takaful Insurance Company's <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> right to conduct its activities, manage its business and funds, and undertake actions required by its commercial activity under the supervision of the trustee, in a manner that preserves its funds and does not harm the interests of creditors, along with the resulting implications. This decision was made against the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, obliging the latter to enable the applicant company to conduct business and grant it the necessary temporary license from the date of the decision's issuance until the completion of the restructuring plan or the termination of procedures.

On 27/6/2024, the bankruptcy judge decided to extend the period for depositing the restructuring plan for another three months, effective from the expiry date of the original period.

On 6/8/2024, the trustee submitted his letter regarding the final list of creditors for Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, attached with what was disclosed in the list.

On 2/10/2024, the trustee submitted his report detailing the most important measures taken in the present application and his recommendations regarding the restructuring plan. The applicant company also submitted its letter concerning the convening of the creditors' committee meeting and the approval of its formation and chairperson at the meeting held on Thursday, 26/9/2024, and the agreement to set 16/10/2024 as the date for inviting creditors to vote on the restructuring plan, attached with a copy of the meeting minutes and the two invitations for forming the creditors' committee and voting on the restructuring plan.

On 24/10/2024, the trustee submitted his letter regarding the meeting of creditors of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> held on 16/10/2024, attached with a detailed statement of the voting results on the restructuring plan and a copy of the creditors' meeting minutes, in which he stated that after auditing and reviewing the voting results, the results were as follows:
- The total accepted and recognized debts amounted to (KWD 12,933,110) twelve million, nine hundred thirty-three thousand, one hundred and ten Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- The total number of attendees was (187 creditors), and their debts amounted to (KWD 7,492,830) seven million, four hundred ninety-two thousand, eight hundred and thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, representing (57.94%) of the total accepted debts.
- The total number of those who approved the plan was (172 creditors), and their debts amounted to (KWD 4,907,355) four million, nine hundred seven thousand, three hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, representing (65.49%) of the total debts of attendees.
- The total number of those who rejected the plan was (15 creditors), and their debts amounted to (KWD 2,585,475) two million, five hundred eighty-five thousand, four hundred and seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, representing (34.51%) of the total debts of attendees.
- And that, according to Law No. (71/2020) issuing the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, the restructuring plan did not obtain the required approval, as its approval and adoption require the consent of two-thirds of the accepted debts of those present at the meeting, equivalent to debts worth (KWD 4,995,220) representing (66.66%), and the difference in debts is worth (KWD 87,865) representing (1.17%).

On 3/11/2024, Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> submitted a memorandum regarding the trustee's report on the creditors' meeting for voting on the present restructuring plan, requesting at its conclusion the ratification of the restructuring plan so that it can commence its operations in accordance with Article (124) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.

On 4/11/2024, the bankruptcy judge decided to instruct the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to notify the debtor and all creditors, in addition to the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and the regulatory authority (Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>), with a copy of the trustee's letter dated 24/10/2024 regarding the meeting of creditors of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> and its attachments, for them to submit their objections within ten days. This decision, along with a copy of the trustee's letter, the voting results statement, and the minutes of the creditors' meeting dated 16/10/2024, shall be published and announced in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and relevant parties shall be notified.

In implementation of the aforementioned decision, the head of the Creditors' Committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig>, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and the companies Elaf Takaful Insurance <orig>إيلاف للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, Baitak Takaful Insurance <orig>بيتك للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, Gulf Insurance Group <orig>مجموعة الخليج للتأمين</orig>, Al-Oula Takaful Insurance <orig>الأولى للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, Bahrain Kuwait Insurance <orig>البحرينية الكويتية للتأمين</orig>, Warba Insurance and Reinsurance <orig>وربة للتأمين وإعادة التأمين</orig>, International Takaful Insurance <orig>الدولي للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, Al-Ahleia Insurance <orig>الأهلية للتأمين</orig>, and Kuwait Qatar Insurance <orig>الكويتية القطرية للتأمين</orig> submitted letters proving their objections to the restructuring plan of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, requesting the rejection of the plan. Furthermore, the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> submitted a letter regarding the voting and sorting procedures at the meeting of creditors of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> held on 16/10/2024, arguing that the procedures referred to in the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> were flawed.
<page_end>132</page_end>

On 18/12/2024, the Trustee submitted his letter regarding the minimum requirements for restarting the activity of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>, concluding that, due to the high financial risks associated with insurance activity and distressed companies in particular, he recommends fulfilling the following minimum requirements for restarting the company:
1.  The company must settle all outstanding individual debts approved by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, amounting to approximately one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
2.  The company must provide a deposit certificate to the order of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> for one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> before commencing activity.
3.  The company must deposit one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> as working capital.
4.  The company must deposit one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> as a solvency margin, especially for new clients.
5.  The company shall not be granted a license to issue motor insurance policies until one year after its restart.
6.  Appoint a new CEO for the company specializing in the insurance field, to be approved by the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
7.  Appoint two independent members to the company's Board of Directors.
8.  The company shall contract with reinsurance companies acceptable to the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
On 14/11/2024, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> submitted a letter requesting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures for the company, pursuant to its application No. (2023/241 Bankruptcy Declaration).
On 21/11/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued a decision instructing Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> to submit a detailed statement of its financial position up to that date, certified by the appointed Trustee.
In implementation of this decision, the Trustee submitted his letter dated 2/2/2025, enclosing the company's financial position report for the period from 1/4/2024 to 30/11/2024.
On 30/11/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to instruct Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> to submit a detailed report issued by one of the actuarial insurance experts approved by the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, with the report including a study of the restructuring plan submitted by the company and a statement of its feasibility in supporting the continuity of its operations.
In accordance with the aforementioned decision, Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> submitted a letter dated 6/2/2025, accompanied by a certificate issued on 2/4/2025 from M International Consulting <orig>ام انترناشيونال للاستشارات</orig> regarding the actuarial opinion on the company's debt restructuring plan.
On 22/12/2024, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> submitted a letter requesting the cancellation of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision issued on 15/5/2024, which granted Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> a temporary license, based on the fact that the company's restructuring plan did not obtain majority approval.
On 5/1/2025 and 9/2/2025, Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> submitted its two letters commenting on the objections of those who rejected the restructuring plan and the Trustee's recommendations contained in his letter dated 18/2/2024, insisting on its request for ratification of the restructuring plan in accordance with the text of Article (124) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, while enabling it to carry out the activities included in the plan to preserve the creditors' rights to collect their debts and ensure the company's continued operations.
Whereas Article (124) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> stipulates that "The Trustee shall, within a maximum period of ten days from the date of the required majority's approval or rejection of the restructuring plan, notify the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> – as the case may be – thereof, and shall attach to the notification the approved or rejected plan, minutes of meetings, and proof of attendance and voting. In the event of approval of the plan, a request for its ratification shall be submitted. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of receiving the notification referred to in the preceding paragraph, notify the debtor and all creditors of the notification referred to in the preceding paragraph and its attachments. In the event of the plan's rejection, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, within a maximum period of ten days from the date of notification by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, issue a decision – upon the debtor's request – to ratify the rejected plan, provided that the rights of the creditors under the rejected plan are not less than what they would have received in the event of the debtor's bankruptcy, after taking the Trustee's opinion on the matter and hearing the creditors' objections, or initiate restructuring procedures and dismiss the application. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, upon a request submitted by the debtor, the supervisory authority, or the creditors – in accordance with what is stipulated in this law regarding the submission of a request to initiate proceedings – decide – by a reasoned decision – to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures."
In light of the foregoing, and since the restructuring plan in the present application did not achieve the legally required majority for its approval, the plan is therefore – by implication – rejected. And since Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> requested the issuance of a decision to ratify the plan, and the creditors submitted their objections to the plan

restructuring, and since the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> expressed his technical opinion regarding the plan and recommended fulfilling a number of requirements as a minimum for the company's re-operation, based on the existence of high financial risks related to insurance activity and distressed companies in particular, and the reasons provided by the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> were convincing and reasonable, leading to the conclusion he reached in his opinion, which is reassuring as to its correctness to be adopted, which led to relying on the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> recommendations, it was decided, and before ruling on the request of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> to ratify the plan, to adopt the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> recommendations while tasking Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> with regularizing its status in accordance with those recommendations, provided that it commits to depositing the necessary legal deposit value for each type of insurance and reinsurance activities as stipulated in Law No. (125/2019) <orig>القانون رقم (2019/125)</orig> regarding the regulation of insurance and its executive regulations, provided that the implementation of this decision shall be under the supervision of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> for a period of six months starting from the date of publication of this decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> also decided on 27/10/2024 that the Applicant Company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> must attend the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, with the latter department tasked with notifying it of the attendance, as well as notifying both the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of the request and its attachments within ten days, and notifying the creditors whose data is listed in the request and its attachments within ten days, while alerting them of their right to respond to the request by means of a memorandum to be deposited with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of notification. Furthermore, the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> is to be notified of a request with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, and the urgent request to suspend enforcement procedures of judgments <orig>الطلب المستعجل بوقف إجراءات تنفيذ الأحكام</orig> issued in the appeals <orig>الاستئنافات</orig> referred to in the request memorandum is to be postponed, with the necessary action to be taken regarding it as developments arise.

All creditors whose names are listed in the creditors' data statement <orig>كشف بيانات الدائنين</orig> attached to the papers and mentioned in the preamble of this decision <orig>ديباجة هذا القرار</orig> were notified, and they were provided with the request data and its attachments via a portable storage device (flash memory) <orig>ذاكرة تخزين متنقلة (فلاش ميموري)</orig>. Accordingly, it was recorded in the session minutes <orig>محضر جلسة</orig> of 28/11/2024 that Lawyer / Dr. Issa Humaid Al-Enezi <orig>د. عيسى حميد العنزي</orig>, in his capacity as agent for the creditor against whom the first party, Amjad Holding Company Limited <orig>شركة أمجاد القابضة المحدودة</orig>, submitted his memorandum dated 26/11/2024 in response to the restructuring request <orig>طلب إعادة الهيكلة</orig>. In conclusion, he requested, firstly (originally), the non-acceptance of the restructuring request <orig>طلب إعادة الهيكلة</orig> for being submitted before the deadline, in accordance with the text of item No. 4 of Article 97 of Law No. 71 of 2020 promulgating the Bankruptcy Law <orig>القانون رقم 71 لسنة 2020 بإصدار قانون الإفلاس</orig>. (Alternatively), he requested the rejection of the restructuring request <orig>طلب إعادة الهيكلة</orig> in accordance with the text of Articles 97 and 98 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. Secondly, he requested obliging Al-Oula Investment Company <orig>الشركة الأولى للاستثمار</orig> to pay the expenses as well as the actual legal fees <orig>أتعاب المحاماة الفعلية</orig>. Thirdly, he requested setting the earliest possible session to consider the bankruptcy request <orig>طلب الإفلاس</orig> submitted by Amjad Holding Company Limited <orig>شركة أمجاد القابضة المحدودة</orig> against Al-Oula Investment Company <orig>الشركة الأولى للاستثمار</orig>, registered under No. 115/2024, and preserving all other rights of Amjad Holding Company Limited <orig>شركة أمجاد القابضة المحدودة</orig>. The aforementioned company also deposited a document portfolio in a hard-cover file (green file box) <orig>حافظة مستندات طي ملف مقوى (فايل بوكس أخضر اللون)</orig> containing photocopies of the request submitted by the Applicant Company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, which included a request to initiate preventive settlement procedures <orig>طلب افتتاح إجراءات التسوية الوقائية</orig> registered under No. 1/2023 preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, and of the request submitted by the Applicant Company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> which included debt restructuring <orig>إعادة هيكلة ديونها</orig>, the request as stated in the declaration <orig>مار البيان</orig>.
<page_end>136</page_end>

On 22/12/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued a decision to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to examine the application and the documents submitted therewith, and to provide an opinion thereon, stating whether the substantive conditions for initiating restructuring procedures are met or not, in accordance with the provisions of Articles 12, 13, 24, 25, 97, and 98 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. This is to determine the feasibility of restructuring, and whether the debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> funds are sufficient to cover the costs of restructuring, and to assess the debtor's financial position and outstanding debts to determine whether the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> is capable of managing its own affairs and assets, or if its interest or the interest of its creditors <orig>دائنيها</orig> requires entrusting the management of the applicant company's assets to a trustee <orig>أمين</orig>. In the latter case, the name of the proposed trustee shall be stated - after consulting his opinion and obtaining his consent to undertake the responsibilities of managing the restructuring, along with defining the trustee's duties and fees, and indicating whether the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> proposes urgent precautionary measures and the justification for such measures, taking into consideration the application filed against the first company / Amjad Holding Company Limited <orig>شركة أمجاد القابضة المحدودة</orig> registered with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> under number 115/2024 bankruptcy declaration, automated number (243677070), requesting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures for the applicant company upon the execution of this assignment, and to provide us with a detailed report thereon, while working, whenever possible, within the required framework and within the legal deadlines stipulated by the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
In implementation of the previous decision, on 4/2/2025, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> filed its report, outgoing number (129), dated 2/2/2025, in which it outlined a summary of the application and the documents submitted therewith, and referred to the application registered under number 115/2024 bankruptcy declaration, submitted by the first company against which the application was filed, stating that, based on Article 17 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> issued by Law No. 71 of 2020, the restructuring application will be studied as an original application, and the bankruptcy declaration application will be placed as a precautionary application. It added that the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> (the debtor <orig>المدين</orig>) is listed and subject to the supervision of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, and based on the decision issued by the Authority No. 35 of 2022 regarding the calculation of the minimum threshold for accepting a restructuring application, the amount of the restructuring application exceeds the minimum threshold condition according to the aforementioned Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> decision. The report clarified the financial position of the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> and its subsidiaries, and a statement of their profits and losses, and concluded that the financial statements indicate the following: – Upon reviewing the financial statements and the auditor's report, a liquidity deficit is apparent – as current liabilities exceeded current assets by KWD 523,137.26 on December 31, 22023, primarily due to total outstanding legal liabilities amounting to KWD 49,470,820. – That the company's total assets to liabilities reached 144%. The application for preventive settlement and restructuring was rejected. And from the appeal brief against the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision in the application, the applicant company's statement, which was registered under number 2657/2024 Commercial Civil Government Appeal 9, and from the judgment issued in the aforementioned appeal on 17/9/2024, which ruled to reject the appeal and uphold the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision based on its reasons, and from the consolidated financial statements of the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> for the two fiscal years 2022/2023, and from a financial study regarding the applicant company's <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> financial position, which indicates, according to page 25 of the study, that the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> is unable to settle its outstanding obligations to creditors <orig>الدائنين</orig> and is also unable to continue its operations in light of incurring losses and failing to generate cash flows from its operating activities, and from the quarterly balance sheets of the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> for the period from 1/1/2024 to 30/9/2024, and from the supplementary disclosure issued by the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> dated 12/11/2024. Furthermore, the minutes of the session on 8/12/2024 did not include the filing by Lawyer Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Fulaij <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الفليج</orig>, the creditors' <orig>الدائنين</orig> agent, on behalf of 3. Ittihadco General Trading Company <orig>شركة اتحادكو للتجارة العامة</orig>, 8. Sulaiman Nasser Al-Zayed <orig>سليمان ناصر الزايد</orig>, 18. Ahmed Saud Mutlaq Al-Zayed <orig>أحمد سعود مطلق الزيد</orig>, 20. Bader Mohammed Abdul Karim Al-Saeed <orig>بدر محمد عبد الكريم السعيد</orig>, and 21. Al-Anwar Holding Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة الأنوار القابضة</orig>, of a defense memorandum with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, which was reviewed and its contents noted. In it, they concluded with a preliminary approval of the application by the First Investment Company (the debtor <orig>المدين</orig>) to initiate restructuring procedures in accordance with Law No. 71 of 2020 issuing the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its executive regulations, while reserving their right to discuss the plan.

Notwithstanding the provisions of clauses (4), 5, 6, 7, (8) of this Article, the application may be submitted at any time if it is accompanied by evidence of the required majority's approval of the restructuring plan for which the application is submitted.
It is stipulated by the text of Article (99) of the same law that the debtor, after the issuance of a decision to commence restructuring procedures, shall remain in charge of managing his business and assets under the supervision of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, and he may undertake all actions required by his commercial activity, provided that it does not harm the interests of the creditors, unless the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides otherwise. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> may request from the debtor, creditors, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, the supervisor, or the inspector to provide him with any available information or documents regarding the debtor's debts, business, or assets. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> shall take all necessary measures to monitor the debtor's financial operations and verify the soundness of the debtor's management of his assets and business. The executive regulations shall specify the actions and dispositions that the debtor must notify the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> of before undertaking them, and those for which the debtor must obtain the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> approval before carrying them out. And by Article (102) of the same law, the issuance of a decision to commence restructuring procedures results in the suspension of claims starting from the day following the date of this decision until the date of ratification of the restructuring plan. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, upon the debtor's request, issue a certificate of suspension of these claims. "And by Article (104) of the same law, the provisions stipulated in the chapter on Preventive Settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> of this law shall apply to contracts, new financing, and the creditors' committee. "And by Article (105) of the same law, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> of the decision issued for his appointment within ten days from its date of issuance, and shall provide him with all available information regarding the debtor. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, within ten days from the date of notification of his appointment decision, shall undertake the following: 1- Announce a summary of the decision to commence procedures, provided that the announcement includes an invitation to creditors to submit their claims and supporting documents to him within a period not exceeding one month from the date of the announcement. 2- Notify all creditors whose electronic addresses are known to him to provide him with claims and documents within one month from the date of announcing the summary of the decision to commence procedures. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> must provide any additional details not notified to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, whether concerning his creditors or debt amounts, details of any ongoing contracts, and any pending or ongoing judicial proceedings in which the debtor is a party, within the timeframe specified by the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>.
And by Article (110) of the same law, the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> must verify the debts within one month from the expiry of the period specified in clauses (201) of Article (105) of this law, and he may seek assistance from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> or the debtor in this regard.
In the Register of Auditors <orig>سجل مراقبي الحسابات</orig>, the debts subject to the supervision of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> are the companies listed on the stock exchange, collective investment schemes, companies subject to the supervision of The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, units subject to the supervision of the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig>, insurance companies, and wholly state-owned companies, and any other debts that the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> assigns the Committee to supervise, and the suspension of claims and the suspension of any lawsuit or enforcement procedure filed against the debtor related to his assets or debts"...
It is stipulated by the text of Article (34) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that if the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to "accept the commencement of restructuring procedures or declare bankruptcy, the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> shall be appointed in the same decision, and his fees shall be estimated in accordance with the provisions of this law. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, based on a proposal
