The debtor shall chair the meeting, and with the approval of the required majority, the trustee or one of the creditors or others may be appointed to chair the meeting. The debtor shall also send invitations within the deadline specified in the preceding paragraph to the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> if the indebtedness is subject to its supervision, and to the relevant regulatory authority if the debtor is subject to the supervision of a regulatory authority. In the event that the debtor refrains from holding the meeting as specified in the first paragraph of this article, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, upon the request of the trustee or one of the creditors, shall assign the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, even if the indebtedness is not subject to its supervision, or the trustee, to call for a creditors' meeting. The trustee or a person authorized by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> from among its members – as the case may be – shall chair the meeting. If attendance is via modern communication means, the trustee must attend the meeting. In this case, the signatures of the debtor and the trustee or the chairman of the meeting on the minutes may suffice, unless the executive regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of this law stipulate otherwise.
Given the foregoing and in light of the aforementioned legal rules, and since the applicant company has submitted a request to commence restructuring procedures <orig>إجراءات إعادة الهيكلة</orig> against all its creditors, specifying the required procedure and its reason, and has attached the documents and data required by Articles 20 and 98 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> to the extent necessary for the issuance of this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its report, outgoing number (129) dated 20/2/2025, in which it outlined a summary of the request and the documents submitted. The report added that the applicant company (the debtor) is listed and subject to the supervision of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, and based on the decision issued by the Authority No. 35 of 2022 regarding the calculation of the minimum threshold for accepting a restructuring request, the amount of the restructuring request exceeds the minimum threshold condition according to the aforementioned Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> report. The report clarified the financial position of the applicant company and its subsidiaries, and its profit and loss statement. It concluded that the company has sufficient assets to cover all its obligations, placing it in a good financial position, and that it is capable of managing its operations as it continues to generate revenues and also possesses sufficient assets. Due to judicial claims coming into effect, the company is in a deficit to immediately settle these claims, while the company needs sufficient time to settle them. The report concluded with the final opinion that the company has sufficient assets and its financial situation allows for the possibility of entering into restructuring, with a recommendation to appoint the trustee Abdullah Al-Essa <orig>عبد الله العيسى</orig> or any licensed auditor <orig>مراقب حسابي</orig> as determined by the judge for the request.

After the verification of debts is completed, a list of debts shall be deposited with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, which includes the names of the creditors, the amount due to each of them as of the date of commencement of procedures, their supporting documents, the reasons for disputing their debt, and what is deemed appropriate regarding its acceptance or rejection. It shall also include the names of creditors who hold special securities <orig>تأمينات خاصة</orig> over the debtor's assets, specifying the amount due to each of them as of the date of commencement of procedures, and a statement of the securities provided by each of them and their estimated value as of the date of the procedures. The bankruptcy trustee <orig>أمين الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten financial days of depositing the list of debts, announce the list and specify the amounts he deems acceptable for each debt and those he deems rejected. Debts owed to the government due to taxes or fees of all kinds shall be considered accepted debts without the need for the trustee's audit, even if they are disputed by the debtor or others. The value of these debts shall be adjusted in light of any legal rulings issued concerning them.
And by Article (117) of the same law, if the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues a decision to commence restructuring procedures <orig>إجراءات إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, the debtor shall, under the supervision of the trustee, prepare the restructuring plan. The debtor may seek assistance from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> in preparing the plan if the indebtedness is subject to its supervision. The debtor must deposit the plan with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> within a period not exceeding three months from the date of the decision. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may extend this period for a similar or longer duration upon the debtor's request after hearing from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>. In all cases, the required majority must approve any extension that would make the period for preparing and developing the restructuring plan exceed six months. In the event that the restructuring plan is not deposited within the deadline specified in this article, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, upon a request submitted by one of the creditors or the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> if the indebtedness is subject to its supervision, terminate the restructuring procedures <orig>إجراءات إعادة الهيكلة</orig>. The judge shall issue his decision within ten days from the date of submitting the request.
And by Article (119) of the same law, the trustee shall notify the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, if the debt is among those subject to its supervision, monthly of the progress in preparing the restructuring plan. And by Article (120) thereof, the debtor must, within the deadline specified in Article (117) of this law, notify the trustee, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> (if the indebtedness is subject to its supervision), the representative of the creditors' committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig>, and the committee members of the plan and its attachments. The representative of the creditors' committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig> and each of its members must notify the class of creditors they represent of the plan and its attachments no later than the end of the business day following the date of receiving the plan and its attachments. And by Article (122) of the same law, except for the provisions contained in this section, the provisions contained in the chapter on preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> shall apply to the approval of the restructuring plan, the regulation of this approval, the ratification of the plan and the effect of this ratification, as well as the implementation of the plan and the termination of its procedures before its implementation.
<page_end>140</page_end>

with the determination of the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> mission in the first phase and the estimation of his fees, along with the recommendation to take all necessary legal measures to halt the enforcement of judgments issued for the success of the restructuring plan. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> sought the opinion of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, who expressed his preliminary approval for being assigned the task in the Bankruptcy Committee's <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> report. Subsequently, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> ruled to issue a decision to commence restructuring proceedings, assigning the Debtor <orig>المدين</orig>, the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> with what is required in accordance with the aforementioned legal rules and guided by Articles 20, 33, 55, 70, 71, 106, 124 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, as will be stated in the operative part.
Therefore,
We have decided the following:

## First:

Commencement of restructuring proceedings for the application submitted by the Debtor <orig>المدين</orig> (Al-Oula Investment Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة الأولى للاستثمار ش. م. ك عامة</orig>), with a suspension of claims effective from the day following the date of issuance of this decision, in implementation of the legal effect resulting from the issuance of the decision to commence restructuring proceedings, pursuant to Article (102) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. The applicant company shall remain in charge of managing its business and assets under the supervision of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, and is tasked with disclosing this decision on its website and announcing it in two local daily newspapers, one of which shall be published in English, at its own expense, and providing proof thereof. Within ten days from the date of this decision, it shall coordinate with the creditors to form a Creditors' Committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig> composed of representatives from their debt categories, pursuant to Article (70) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. Within ten days from the expiry of the period specified in the preceding article, it shall deposit with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> a list of debt categories and the formation of the Creditors' Committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig>, pursuant to Article (71) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and is tasked, under the supervision of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, with preparing the restructuring plan, and may seek assistance from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> in preparing the plan. The plan shall include the data required by Article (118) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and shall be deposited with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> within a period not exceeding three months from the date of the decision. Subsequently, the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, the representative of the Creditors' Committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig>, and the committee members shall be notified of the plan and its annexes, and creditors shall be invited to approve the restructuring plan by means of a notice specifying the date and place of the meeting, in accordance with the procedures contained in the restructuring plan. The meeting shall be held no later than one month from the date of the aforementioned notice. The Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> shall also be invited to this meeting and tasked, within a maximum period of ten days from the date of the required majority's approval or rejection of the restructuring plan, with notifying the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> thereof. The approved or rejected plan, meeting minutes, and attendance and voting records shall be attached to the notice.

## Second:

By appointing Mr. / Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> Abdullah Marwan Al-Essa <orig>عبدالله مروان العيسى</orig>, whose mission in the first phase shall be to supervise the restructuring plan for a period not exceeding three months. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> shall announce a summary of this decision, which includes inviting creditors to submit their claims and supporting documents, and notifying all creditors whose electronic addresses are known to him to provide the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> with claims and documents within one month of the creditors' invitation. He shall prepare a register to record all known creditors of the Debtor <orig>المدين</orig>, provided that the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> submits an updated copy of the entries in that register to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>. Subsequently, the debts shall be verified within one month from the expiry of the period for submitting creditors' claims, provided that after the completion of debt verification, a list of debts shall be deposited with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, which includes the names of the creditors, whether they hold special securities over the Debtor's <orig>المدين</orig> assets, the amount due to each of them, their documents, and the reasons for disputing their debts. Within the ten days following the deposit of the debt list, he shall announce the list and specify the amounts that the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> deems acceptable for each debt and those he deems rejected. The two aforementioned announcements shall be made in two local daily newspapers, one of which shall be published in English, at the expense of the applicant company. The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> shall notify the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> monthly of the progress in preparing the restructuring plan. We have estimated the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> fees for the first phase, for 100 hours, at a total amount of 5000 K.D. (Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>خمسة آلاف دينار كويتي</orig>).

## Third:

The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this decision and disclose it on the Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> (Kuwait Stock Exchange), and notify the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> of this appointment decision within ten days, as well as notify the applicant company, the creditors against whom the application was filed, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, Boursa Kuwait <orig>شركة بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig>, and the General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> of this decision, affix the executive formula to it, and publish it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

On 8 July 2024, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> issued its report, concluding with the following decisions: First: Rejecting the bankruptcy declaration request for the First Defendant / Fahad Ahmed Fahad Al-Malik <orig>فهد احمد فهد المالك</orig>. Second: Referring the bankruptcy declaration request documents for the Second Defendant (Robust Gulf General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة روباست جلف للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>) to the competent court regarding the claim against it, Judgment No. 17107 / 2019 Commercial Plenary / 25, which obligates the Second Defendant to pay the Plaintiff the amount of KWD 59,688.180. The court inquired about the aforementioned judgment and it was found that it had not been appealed.

Head of the Bankruptcy Circuit
In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Plenary Court
Bankruptcy Department / 2
In the session held publicly at the court on Monday, 17 February 2025 AD.
Presided by Professor: Othman Al-Kandari <orig>عثمان الكندري</orig>, Court Agent
And with the membership of Professor: Abdullah Al-Othman <orig>عبدالله العثمان</orig>, Court Agent
And in the presence of Mr.: Abdulaziz Al-Otaiq <orig>عبدالعزيز العتيق</orig>, Session Secretary
(The following judgment was issued)
In Case No. (2024/28) Bankruptcy Circuit / 2
Automated Number: (242518380)
Filed by: Foundations Projects for Groundwater Dewatering and Pile Installation <orig>مشاريع الأساسات لسحب المياه الجوفية وتثبيت الركائز</orig>
Against:
1- Fahad Ahmed Fahad Al-Malik <orig>فهد احمد فهد المالك</orig>.
2- Robust Gulf General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة روباست جلف للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
The facts of the case are that the Plaintiff (Foundations Projects for Groundwater Dewatering Company <orig>شركة مشاريع الأساسات لسحب المياه الجوفية</orig>) submitted a request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the Second Defendant (Robust Gulf General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة روباست جلف للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>), based on the fact that the Plaintiff obtained Judgment No. 17107 / 2019 Commercial Plenary / 25, which obligates the Second Defendant to pay the Plaintiff the amount of KWD 59,688.180 (fifty-nine thousand six hundred eighty-eight Dinars and 180 Fils), and that the Plaintiff took enforcement measures against it, including bank attachments, car attachments, and real estate attachments. However, it was found that the Defendant had no funds, which indicates a disturbed financial position and a struggling financial distress, leading the Plaintiff to submit the present request.
In the session of 11 May 2023, the Bankruptcy Judge decided to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to examine the request and the availability of its substantive conditions, in accordance with the provisions of Articles 12, 25, and 71 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 / 2020. This was to determine whether the debtor is capable of managing his business and bankruptcy assets, or if his interest and the interest of the creditors require that the management of the debtor's assets be entrusted to a trustee, and in the former case, to state the name of the proposed trustee for restructuring or bankruptcy and his fees, and to indicate whether the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> suggests taking urgent precautionary measures or not, and the justification for that according to the submitted documents.
On 7 January 2024, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> decided to appoint Mr./ Abdul Latif <orig>عبد اللطيف</orig>

Whereas the case was circulated in the Civil Circuit, its registration as recorded in the session minutes, and in the session of 13 January 2025, the Plaintiff's attorney appeared and requested a postponement to review the reports of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and the referral decision.
The two defendants did not appear despite being notified, and the court decided to issue its judgment in today's session.
And since it is from the subject matter, as stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020, which states: "In applying the provisions of this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each of them ..... Financial deficit in which the debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."
Article 29 of the same law stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Judge shall decide on the request within ten days from the date of the periods specified for responding to it, by issuing his decision to commence preventive settlement procedures, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration, and shall specify in his decision a temporary date for suspension of payment. If the decision to commence procedures is issued after the debtor's death or after his retirement from trade and no date for suspension of payment is specified, the date of death or retirement from trade shall be considered a temporary date for suspension of payment."
Article 33 of the same law stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's decision to commence, reject, or not accept the procedures, publish and announce the decision and notify the concerned parties."
Article 34 of the same law stipulates that "If the Bankruptcy Judge decides to accept the commencement of restructuring or bankruptcy declaration procedures, he shall appoint in the same decision the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been estimated in accordance with the provisions of the law."
Article 131 of the same law stipulates that "...... The Bankruptcy Judge shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions for 'continuity' are met: 1- The debtor is in suspension of payment. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not capable of continuity."
Article 132 of the same law stipulates that "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the request for commencement of procedures to the Bankruptcy Declaration Court within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's decision, and the file agent shall submit a report on the procedures taken for the request since its submission."

In lawsuit No.: (2024/29) Bankruptcy Circuit / 2
Automated No.: (242538990)
Filed by: Gulf Shores for Sanitary Ware and Building Materials Company (LLC) <orig>شركة شواطئ الخليج للأدوات الصحية ومواد البناء</orig>.

Against:
1- Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقا ولاتها</orig>.
2- Mohammed Abdul Mohsen Nasser Al-Adwani <orig>محمد عبد المحسن ناصر العدواني</orig> – in his personal capacity and as a partner in Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقا ولاتها</orig>.
3- Mohammed Ibrahim Suleiman Haj Asaad <orig>محمد إبراهيم سليمان حاج أسعد</orig> – in his personal capacity and as a partner and manager of Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقا ولاتها</orig>.

(Reasons)

After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating according to law:
The facts of the lawsuit are that the plaintiff (Gulf Shores for Sanitary Ware and Building Materials Company <orig>شركة شواطئ الخليج للأدوات الصحية ومواد البناء</orig>) submitted a request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the defendant (Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقا ولاتها</orig>) due to its cessation of payments and financial insolvency, as it had obtained judgment No. 2512/

until the issuance of the decision to commence proceedings, with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision.
Article 144 of the same law stipulates that "Upon the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings, the debtor's hand shall be restrained from disposing of his funds and affairs and from managing them. The trustee shall manage the debtor's funds and assets. All dispositions made by the debtor on the day of the aforementioned decision shall be considered as having occurred after its issuance, and any disposition issued contrary thereto shall be deemed null and void. The trustee may file a lawsuit before the Bankruptcy Court to obtain a judgment of its non-enforceability, and may also submit the necessary requests to the Bankruptcy Judge to take necessary precautionary measures to protect the rights of creditors. The restraint on the debtor's hand shall not prevent him from taking the necessary measures to preserve his rights, provided that it does not harm the interests of the creditors."
Furthermore, it is established in cassation jurisprudence that "While a judge may not rule based on his private knowledge, he is not prohibited from ruling based on general knowledge. And it is considered general knowledge that does not require proof of its existence, the customary reliance on data and figures published on the internet, including official government websites." (Appeals Nos. 3368 – 3318 / 2019 Commercial / 4 Session 5/11/2025)
Given the foregoing, and as it is established in the documents that the civil company – the defendant – Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقا ولاتها</orig>.
of the Commercial Law, and since the debts subject to the present request have been proven by final and conclusive judicial judgments, and the debtor (the defendant) is unable to pay its debts, which resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings against it and the appointment of a trustee for its bankruptcy, and in accordance with Article 132 of the aforementioned law, the Bankruptcy Department attached its report in preparation for issuing a judgment declaring its bankruptcy after completing all procedures required by law. Furthermore, the defendant did not attend any of the court sessions to contest this request with any defense, or the wisdom of those procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department, and the wisdom dictates declaring its bankruptcy as will be stated in the operative part.
As for the lawsuit expenses, including actual attorney's fees, the Court obliges the first defendant to pay them in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1, 119 bis of the Code of Civil Procedure and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law.
(For these reasons)

The Court ruled: -
To declare the bankruptcy of the second defendant / Robust Gulf General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة روباست جلف للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> and to set 8/7/2024 as the provisional date for cessation of payments. The Bankruptcy Department shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register and publish its summary in the Official Gazette in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and add the expenses and an amount of one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (K.D. 100) for actual attorney's fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate.

Session Secretary
Deputy Judge

At the session on 2023/9/14, the bankruptcy judge decided to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to examine the request and the extent to which the substantive conditions are met, in accordance with the provisions of Articles 12 - 13 - 14 - 25 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020. (REASONS)
After reviewing the documents, hearing the pleadings, and deliberating legally:
*   Whereas the facts of the case have been previously covered by the decision of the Bankruptcy Department issued on 19/12/2024, to which the Court refers to avoid prolixity and repetition. However, the Court summarizes the facts of the case to the extent sufficient to connect the elements of this judgment, in that the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge dated 19/12/2024 states that the plaintiff filed a request on 13/11/2023 for the declaration of bankruptcy of the defendant, based on the Public Prosecution having attributed to the defendant in Case No. 305/2013 Misdemeanors East that he possessed the cash amounts specified in green, owned by Al-Mubarakiya National Poultry and Egg Production Company <orig>شركة المباركية الوطنية للدواجن وإنتاج البيض</orig>, and entrusted to him as a trustee in his capacity as a partner and director of the company, by importing special poultry feed for his own account using invoices from Al-Wafi Kuwaiti Company <orig>شركة الوافي الكويتية</orig> to then sell them to Al-Mubarakiya National Poultry and Egg Production Company <orig>شركة المباركية الوطنية للدواجن وإنتاج البيض</orig>, in which he is a partner with the victim - the plaintiff - as detailed in the documents. The defendant was brought to criminal trial, and the esteemed Court sentenced him - the defendant - to two years imprisonment with labor for the amended charges related to the association, and ordered a bail of two thousand dinars for suspension of execution until the judgment becomes final, and obligated the defendant - the accused - to pay the plaintiff a temporary amount of five thousand one hundred and fifty dinars for moral damages. The first-degree court judgment was appealed by the defendant via appeal, and his appeal was registered under No. 4492/2017.
bankruptcy within ten days from the request to commence proceedings to the Bankruptcy Court within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's rulings on the declaration of bankruptcy, and a report on the procedures taken for the request from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence proceedings shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
Article 144 of the same law stipulates that "Upon the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings, the debtor's hand shall be restrained from disposing of his funds and affairs, and the trustee shall manage the debtor's funds and assets. All dispositions made by the debtor on the day of the issuance of the aforementioned decision shall be considered as having occurred after its issuance, and any disposition made contrary thereto shall be considered null and void. The trustee may file a lawsuit before the Bankruptcy Court to obtain a judgment of its non-enforceability, and may also submit the necessary requests to the Bankruptcy Judge to take the necessary precautionary measures to protect the rights of creditors. The debtor's hand shall not be restrained from taking the necessary measures to preserve his rights, provided that it does not harm the interests of the creditors."
Given the foregoing, and as it is established in the documents that the debtor company - the defendant - Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting LLC <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقاولاتها ذ م م</orig> has the status of a merchant, Articles (1 - 2 - 3 - 4 - 8 - 12) of the Commercial Law apply to it. And since the debts subject of the similar request have been established by one hundred and twenty-eight judicial rulings (against the defendant) regarding the payment of its debts, which resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings and the appointment of a trustee for its bankruptcy. In accordance with Article 132 of the aforementioned law, the Bankruptcy Department attached its report in preparation for issuing a judgment declaring its bankruptcy after fulfilling all procedures required by law. Furthermore, the defendant did not attend any of the court sessions to present any defense against this request, nor did the Court find any defense that would undermine the validity of the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department, and thus the Court rules for its bankruptcy. Therefore, the Court affirms the validity of the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department and rules for its bankruptcy, as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.
As for the litigation costs, including actual attorney's fees, the Court obligates the first defendant to pay them, in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119, 119 bis of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(FOR THESE REASONS)
### THE COURT RULED:
To declare the bankruptcy of the defendant / Al-Almani Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Contracting LLC <orig>شركة الألماني الأولى للأدوات الصحية ومقاولاتها ذ م م</orig>, and to set 25/5/2025 as the provisional date for cessation of payments. *   And whereas the court decided to reserve the case for judgment to be issued today.
*   And whereas, regarding the subject matter of the lawsuit and the plaintiff's requests therein, it is stipulated by the text of Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 71 لسنة 2020</orig>, which states that "In applying the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each of them ..... Financial insolvency: the debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."
*   And Article 2 of the same law stipulated that "The provisions of this law apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies ...".
*   And Article 29 thereof stipulated that "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall decide on the application within ten days from the date of the periods specified for responding to it, by issuing his decision to commence preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> or restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig> procedures or declare bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig>, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the cessation of payments. If the decision to commence procedures does not specify the date on which the debtor ceased payments, the date of issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be considered a provisional date for the cessation of payments. If the decision to commence procedures is issued after the debtor's death or after his retirement from trade and the date of cessation of payments is not specified, the date of death or retirement from trade shall be considered a provisional date for the cessation of payments. And Article 33 stipulated that the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence or reject or not accept the procedures, publish and announce the decision and notify the concerned parties thereof .... And Article 34 stipulated that if the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the commencement of restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig> or bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> procedures, he shall appoint in the same decision the trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been assessed in accordance with the provisions of this law .... And Article 49 stipulated that the trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> shall recover his fees and expenses incurred by him and the necessary expenses incurred from the debtor's known funds for the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, and a payment of such fees and expenses may be disbursed on account by a decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>.
*   And Article 131 of the same law stipulated that "...... the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
*   And Article 132 of the same law stipulated that "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the application to commence procedures to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>المحكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> procedures, and a report on the procedures taken shall be deposited in the file, stating the factual and legal grounds for the decision."

commercial transactions and adopted them as his profession, he shall be considered a merchant. And that every creditor with a due commercial debt has the right to request the declaration of bankruptcy of his debtor, the merchant, if the merchant's business is disturbed and he ceases to pay his debt in a manner that indicates a disturbed financial position and entrenched difficulties that shake the merchant's creditworthiness, thereby exposing the rights of his creditors to danger. And that the determination of whether a person is a merchant or not, and the determination of the facts constituting the state of cessation of payment that leads to the declaration of bankruptcy of the merchant, are matters that the court of substance <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig> independently decides, provided it states valid reasons for that.
*   It has been established, and as ruled by the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig>, that "the court of substance <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig> has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it, to prefer what it deems preferable among them, and to deduce what it believes to be the reality of the case. Its assessment of this and its determination of its sufficiency for conviction are solely within its purview, provided that this assessment is sound and does not deviate from what is established in the case documents...".
(Appeals 555, 599/2005 Commercial, Session 8/10/2006)
*   Since this is the case, and guided by the foregoing, and given that the plaintiff's request was for a judgment declaring the defendant's bankruptcy due to his refusal to pay the debt owed by him, and it is legally established that for a judgment declaring a debtor's bankruptcy, several conditions must be met: proof of his status as a merchant, his cessation of payment of a debt owed by him due to his financial inability, and that his business is not sustainable. Upon the court's examination of the case documents and the application submitted to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the procedures taken therein, it finds that these conditions apply to the defendant, as his refusal to pay a debt owed by him, established by a final and enforceable judgment, due to his financial inability, has been proven. This resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> and the appointment of a trustee for him, in accordance with the aforementioned Article 132. Therefore, the court deems the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and its judge in handling the present application to be valid. Consequently, the plaintiff's request for the defendant's bankruptcy declaration is based on sound factual and legal grounds, and the court rules for the defendant's bankruptcy declaration as will be stated in the operative part.
*   As for the expenses, the court obliges the defendant to bear them in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)
### The Court ruled:-
To declare the bankruptcy of the defendant / Abdulaziz Ahmed Hassan Al-Sarraf <orig>عبد العزيز أحمد حسن الصراف</orig>, and to set 13/11/2023 as the provisional date for cessation of payment. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and publish its summary in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and add the expenses to the bankruptcy estate.

# Resolution
## Article One
For the purpose of applying the provisions of this Resolution, the definitions contained in Article 1 of Law No. 106 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 106 لسنة 2013</orig> concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig> shall form an integral part of this Resolution, with the addition of the following definitions:
- Low-Risk Violations: These are unintentional violations that do not harm reputation, are very limited, and are classified as low-risk.
- Medium-Risk Violations: These are violations that cause moderate reputational harm and are classified as medium-risk.
- High-Risk Violations: These are violations that pose a risk of reputational harm at both local and international levels and are classified as high-risk.

## Article Two
Violations shall be classified based on the provisions of Law No. (106) of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم (106) لسنة 2013</orig> concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>, its executive regulations, and related ministerial resolutions, according to the type of violation and risk level, as follows:

1.  **Low-Risk Violations**: One of the precautionary measures stipulated in Article (15) of the aforementioned Law shall be applied, according to the following table:

<table_caption>Administrative and Disciplinary Penalties for Low-Risk Violations</table_caption>
<table>
| Violation | Measure and Applicable Penalties |
|:--------|:---|
| Failure to comply with due diligence procedures for invoices less than 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> due to unintentional error | - If the total number of invoices is less than 50, a written warning of the violation shall be issued. - If the total number of invoices is more than 50, an order shall be issued requiring compliance with specific procedures and suspension of the license for one month. |
| Failure to provide a continuous training program for the establishment's employees to ensure their awareness of anti-money laundering and terrorist financing requirements | - A written warning of the violation, and in case of repetition, the penalty shall be escalated to an order requiring compliance with specific procedures, and in case of a third repetition, the license shall be suspended for 3 months. |
| Executing a transaction based on incomplete or slightly inaccurate documents without strong indicators of suspicious activities (e.g., failure to specify payment method in some invoices - failure to attach electronic payment receipt - failure to mention all required data in the invoice) | - A written warning of the violation, and in case of repetition, the penalty shall be escalated to an order requiring compliance with specific procedures, and in case of a third repetition, the license shall be suspended for 3 months. |
| Breach of any other obligations related to the controls and decisions issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and the Kuwaiti Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> | - A written warning of the violation, and in case of repetition, the license shall be suspended for 3 months. |
</table>

2.  **Medium-Risk Violations**: Financial penalties ranging from 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to not exceeding 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be applied, according to the following table:

<table_caption>Financial Penalties for Medium-Risk Violations</table_caption>
<table>
| Violation | Measure and Applicable Penalties |
|:--------|:---|
| Dealing with cash amounts exceeding 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> | - If the total number of invoices is less than 50, a financial penalty of 1,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed on the total invoices. - If the total number of invoices is more than 50, a financial penalty of 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed on the total invoices. |
| Failure to appoint a Kuwaiti compliance officer <orig>مراقب التزام</orig> knowledgeable in anti-money laundering and terrorist financing laws and related ministerial resolutions, and to inform the administration of any updates to the officer's appointment | - An order requiring compliance with the appointment of the officer, and in case of repetition, a financial penalty of 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed. |
| Failure to apply due diligence procedures for invoices exceeding 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> | - If the total number of invoices is less than 50, a financial penalty of 1,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed. - If the total number of invoices is more than 50, a financial penalty of 3,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed. |
| Failure of the establishment to retain financial records for five years | - An order requiring compliance, and in case of repetition, a financial penalty of 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed. |
| Failure to report the client relationship when due diligence measures cannot be applied | - An order requiring compliance, and in case of repetition, a financial penalty of 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be imposed. |
| Failure to comply with establishing internal policies, procedures, systems, and controls related to combating | - A financial penalty of 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, and in case of repetition, the amount shall be doubled to 1,000 Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> |
</table>

- And on Ministerial Decision <orig>القرار الوزاري</orig> No. 2014/5 regarding the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for the implementation of Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> Resolutions issued under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter <orig>ميثاق الأمم المتحدة</orig> related to combating terrorism and financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
- And on Kuwaiti Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء الكويتي</orig> Resolution No. 827 issued on 23/6/2019, regarding the approval of authorizing the Deputy Prime Minister <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> to issue the necessary decisions for implementing Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> resolutions issued under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter <orig>ميثاق الأمم المتحدة</orig> related to combating terrorism and financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction without referring to the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>.
Based on the Deputy Minister's submission.
And pursuant to the exigencies of work.

### Chapter One: Definitions
UN Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة عقوبات الأمم المتحدة</orig>: United Nations Security Council Sanctions Committees <orig>لجان عقوبات مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> established pursuant to Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> resolutions 1267 (1999), 1988 (2011), 1718 (2011), (2006).

money laundering and terrorist financing and circulating them to local and foreign branches (if any)
- Failure to circulate awareness bulletins on combating money laundering and terrorist financing to employees in the commercial establishment.
- Failure to implement an electronic invoicing system in the establishment and dealing with manual invoices.
- Failure of the establishment to identify the beneficial owner of the purchase transaction and retain the beneficial owner's ownership structure.

### 3- High-Risk Violations: Financial penalties ranging from 4,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to not exceeding 10,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> are applied according to the following table:

| Failure to submit the establishment's risk assessment study. | - A financial penalty of 500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> will be imposed, and in case of repetition, the amount will be doubled to 1,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. |

### Article Three
Financial penalties are not intended to harm the violating party, but rather are imposed to ensure compliance. The fine may be reduced based on the severity of the violation, as shown in the preceding tables. However, requests for mitigation of penalties will only be considered if supported by clear, complete, and verifiable evidence, including all required documents proving the validity of the request.

### Article Four
Ministerial Decision <orig>القرار الوزاري</orig> No. (139) of 2021 regarding the matrix of violations and penalties related to financial institutions and non-financial professions subject to the supervision of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and related to combating money laundering and terrorist financing, is hereby repealed, as is any other decision that contradicts this decision.

### Article Five
Ministry officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, which shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its publication.

**Person**: Any natural or legal person, and any group of natural and/or legal persons.

**Law**: Refers to Law No. 106 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 106 لسنة 2013</orig> concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing, and all its subsequent amendments, and any other laws that may be issued in the future.

**Supervisory Authority**: Includes any authority falling under the definition of this term as specified in Law No. (106) of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم (106) لعام 2013</orig> and any subsequent amendments thereto, in addition to the Executive Regulations of this Law issued pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (37) of 2013 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم (37) لعام 2013</orig> and any of its subsequent amendments.

**Listed Person**: Any person listed by the Special Committee in accordance with Article 11, or by the United Nations sanctions or the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> pursuant to a relevant United Nations Security Council resolution.

**Relevant United Nations Security Council Resolution (UNSCR)**:
A Security Council resolution issued under Chapter VII <orig>الفصل السابع</orig> of the United Nations Charter aimed at preventing, suppressing, and financing terrorism or its financing, and related to preventing, suppressing, and disrupting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction and their financing, including but not limited to the following resolutions: 2253, 2255, 1718, 1874, 2087, 2094, 2270, 2321, 1452, 1988, 1989, 2178, 2356, 2371, 2375, 2397, 2610, 2611, 2734, and all current or future relevant resolutions.

**Special Committee**: The committee formed in accordance with these regulations.

**Competent Authority**: The entities included within the meaning of the term as specified in Law No. (106) of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم (106) لعام 2013</orig> and any of its subsequent amendments, and the Executive Regulations of this Law issued pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (37) of 2013 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم (37) لعام 2013</orig> and any subsequent amendments.

**Funds or Economic Resources**: Include all types, including financial assets and properties of all kinds, whether tangible or intangible, movable or immovable, regardless of the method of acquisition, and legal documents or instruments in all their forms, including electronic or digital, that prove the right or interest in such funds or other assets. This includes, but is not limited to, bank credits, traveler's checks, bank checks, money transfers, shares, securities, bonds, promissory notes, or letters of credit, and any interest, profits, or other income generated from or accrued on them, and any other assets that may be used to obtain funds, goods, or services. The term "economic resources" includes equipment, furniture, accessories and fixtures; fixed resources such as ships, aircraft, and motor vehicles; inventories of goods; arts; jewelry and gold; goods including oil and refined products, standard refineries and recycled materials including chemicals, lubricants, metals or timber or other natural resources, weapons and related materials, raw materials and components that can be used in the manufacture of improvised explosive devices and unconventional weapons, patents, trademarks, copyrights, and other forms of intellectual property, internet hosting and related services.

**Freezing of Funds or Economic Resources**: Refers to the prohibition and prevention of any transfer, alteration, disposal, modification, use, circulation, or movement of funds or economic resources in any way that may lead to a change in their size, amount, location, ownership, possession, nature, or destination, or that may enable the use of such funds or resources for any purpose.

### Chapter Two: The Special Committee

### Article 1
The Special Committee is chaired by the Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs for Development and International Cooperation Affairs, and its membership includes:
1. Vice-Chairman, Deputy Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs for Development and International Cooperation Affairs
2. A representative from the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
3. A representative from the Kuwaiti Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig>
4. A representative from the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
5. A representative from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>
6. A representative from the Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>
7. A representative from the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>
8. A representative from the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>
9. A representative from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
10. A representative from the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
11. A representative from the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
12. A representative from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
13. A representative from the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>

### Article 2
The Chairman of the Special Committee is tasked with nominating the rapporteur of the Special Committee and the committee secretariat. The Chairman may invite any entity in Kuwait that is not a member of the Special Committee and any suitable expert to attend committee meetings.

### Article 3
The rapporteur of the Special Committee and its secretariat shall have the following duties:
1.  Issuing invitations for the Special Committee meetings.
2.  Documenting its meeting minutes and preserving its records, decisions, and all work related to the Special Committee's activities.
3.  Notifying the Chairman of the Special Committee and its members of the meeting date at least (10) working days in advance. This period may be shortened in cases of extreme necessity upon the Chairman's request and according to the period he specifies.
4.  Providing all members of the Special Committee with the agenda, items, and topics for discussion, supported by the necessary documents and information.
5.  Providing the Chairman of the Special Committee and its members with a draft of the meeting minutes within 5 working days for review and feedback, in preparation for their adoption at the next meeting.
6.  Providing members of the Special Committee with a copy of all the Committee's decisions.

### Article 4
The Chairman of the Special Committee may request assistance from anyone he deems appropriate for the Committee's work.

### Article 5
The Special Committee shall be considered the liaison between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and the concerned foreign authorities.

### Article 6
A member of the Special Committee must meet the following conditions:
1.  Must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2.  Must be nominated by the entity to which he belongs. A member may not refuse membership in the Special Committee except by an official letter from the nominating entity. If a member is unable to attend more than three consecutive times without an acceptable excuse, the Chairman of the Special Committee shall request the nominating entity to nominate another member who meets the membership conditions.
3.  Must be fully aware of relevant international resolutions, national legislation, and instructions issued by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the field of combating terrorism and accepting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
4.  Must be at a supervisory level, no less than (Department Director <orig>مدير إدارة</orig>), possessing good knowledge of the powers of the entity he represents in the Special Committee, especially in the field of combating terrorism and accepting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
5.  Must be authorized by the entity he represents in the Special Committee with the powers and authorities that enable him to make appropriate decisions related to combating terrorism and accepting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
6.  Must have full proficiency in the English language, given the nature of the Special Committee's tasks and the tasks related to necessary communication with external parties or external meetings attended by Committee members.
7.  Must commit to submitting semi-annual reports to the Committee on the measures taken by the entity to which he belongs regarding resolutions issued by the Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter <orig>ميثاق الأمم المتحدة</orig>, provided that these reports are discussed during the Special Committee's sessions.

### Article 7
Members of the Special Committee must:
1.  Not disclose information and data available to the member by virtue of his membership in the Special Committee to others, except within the limits permitted by relevant laws and instructions and other matters related to the nature of his work.
2.  Not disclose information and data available to the member by virtue of his membership in the Special Committee to various media outlets or social media without the permission of the Committee Chairman.
3.  Attend all Special Committee meetings at the scheduled times.
4.  Complete all assigned tasks and provide all requested data and information.
5.  Permanently and continuously adhere to all controls contained in this decision.
6.  The Special Committee member shall be the point of contact between the Special Committee and the entity he works for, where he will be addressed directly on all matters related to the Committee's work.

### Article 8
The Special Committee shall hold its meetings according to the following mechanisms:
1.  The meeting shall be held upon the request of the Chairman of the Special Committee or his deputy, or upon the request of at least half of the Special Committee members.
2.  The Chairman of the Committee shall preside over the Committee's meetings, and in his absence, the Vice-Chairman shall preside over the meeting.
3.  The Special Committee may invite anyone it deems appropriate for consultation or to hear their opinion on a specific matter without having the right to vote, provided they are of Kuwaiti nationality.
4.  The member must attend the Special Committee meetings in person.
5.  The Special Committee shall meet every three months or whenever the need arises.

### Chapter Three
Listing on the National List by the Special Committee pursuant to Security Council Resolution 1373

### Article 9
The quorum for the Special Committee shall be determined as follows:
1. Quorum: The quorum for the Special Committee's meetings shall be met by the presence of half of the members +1, including the Chairman or the Vice-Chairman in the absence of the Chairman.
2. If the quorum is not met at the beginning of the meeting, the meeting shall be postponed for half an hour to allow members to attend and complete the quorum. If members do not attend after the specified period, the rapporteur of the Special Committee shall send a letter to all members explaining that the meeting has been canceled due to the lack of a quorum, and the meeting shall be rescheduled for a later date.

### Article 10
The voting mechanism in the Special Committee shall be as follows:
1. The Special Committee shall take its decisions by a majority vote of the members present. In case of a tie, the side where the Chairman is present shall prevail.
2. A member who fails to attend the meeting shall not have the right to object to decisions approved during the Committee's meeting.
3. The Committee may issue some of its decisions by circulation, based on the following controls:
    a- The necessity of the matter requires issuing the decision by circulation, and the Chairman shall assess the state of necessity.
    b- Decisions issued by circulation must be presented at the Committee's next meeting and recorded in the meeting minutes.

### Article 11
In addition to the responsibilities stipulated in other chapters of this Ministerial Decision, the Special Committee shall undertake the following tasks:
1. Coordinating efforts between the competent authorities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
2. Participating in relevant conferences and committees.
3. Requesting documents or data that the Committee deems necessary from the competent authorities to enable it to perform its tasks.
4. Issuing instructions and directives for the implementation of listing decisions to the competent authorities or the private sector.
5. Regular follow-up of the database established by the Special Committee to track its work.
6. Submitting periodic reports to the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> on its activities and providing recommendations every six months or upon request.

### Article 12
The Special Committee, either on its own initiative or based on a request from a competent foreign or local authority, shall list any person reasonably suspected of:
a. Having committed or attempting to commit a terrorist act, or participating in or facilitating the commission of a terrorist act;
b. Acting directly or indirectly for, or being controlled by, a person according to the criteria mentioned in paragraph (a);
c. Acting on behalf of or under the direction of a person according to the criteria mentioned in paragraph (a).

### Article 13
The Special Committee has the authority to collect and request any information from any public authority, person, or entity in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to determine whether the person meets the listing criteria in accordance with Article 12. The Special Committee and its members may not notify the concerned person that their listing is under consideration.

### Article 14
When the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> receives a request from a foreign or local authority to list a person, the Special Committee shall immediately consider this request and make a decision thereon. In this regard, the Committee shall seek to obtain from the foreign or local authority as much identifying and supporting information for the request as possible, such as: the proposed name, sufficient identifying information for accurate and positive identification of the person, and specific information supporting the determination of whether the person meets the criteria specified in Article 12, in accordance with the internal procedures of the Special Committee. The Special Committee shall issue a decision and notify the foreign or local authority of the decision in writing.

### Article 15
Listing under Article 12 does not depend on the existence of any criminal proceedings against the person, such as investigation, prosecution, or otherwise. The Special Committee shall immediately notify the concerned financial institutions, companies, non-financial professions, supervisory authorities, and other competent entities of any listing decision and any available identifying information through the automated email alert system. Thereafter, the listing decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and this information shall be announced on the Committee's dedicated webpage.

Chapter Five: Obligations Related to Specific Financial Sanctions

## Article 16
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> may request any foreign entity to implement a listing decision it has taken in accordance with Article 12. When sending such a request, the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall provide as much identifying information and supporting information for the decision as possible, including the name of the proposed person and any information necessary for the accurate and positive identification of persons and to support the determination of whether the person meets the criteria stipulated in Article 12.

## Article 17
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall review the listing decision in accordance with Article 12 at least every two years to ensure the continued existence of reasonable grounds for retaining the decision for each case, unless circumstances necessitate a review of the listing decision before the end of the annual period.
If the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> finds that the available information no longer constitutes reasonable grounds to believe or suspect that the person meets the classification criteria, the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall lift the listing decision in accordance with the provisions of this Resolution.
Chapter Four: Submitting Listing Proposals to the United Nations

## Article 18
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall submit a proposal to the Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> or one of the United Nations <orig>الأمم المتحدة</orig> Sanctions Committees <orig>لجان العقوبات</orig> for the listing of a person if it has reasonable grounds to believe that this person meets the classification criteria stipulated in the relevant United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن الدولي</orig> resolution, other than Resolution 1373. These criteria are detailed in the annex to this Resolution.

## Article 19
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall propose to the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> or the United Nations Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات التابعة للأمم المتحدة</orig> the listing of a person who must:
1. The person's name shall be submitted without prior notice, and shall not be conditional on the existence of criminal proceedings against the proposed person for listing, such as a criminal investigation, trial, or otherwise.
2. It shall be in accordance with the listing procedures and forms approved by the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> or the relevant Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات</orig>.
3. It shall include as much information as possible regarding the proposed person, stating the case, and the details on which the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> relied when submitting its proposal. The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> must also determine whether the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> will be identified as the proposing state by the United Nations <orig>الأمم المتحدة</orig> or not.

## Article 20
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> has the authority to collect and request any information from any public authority, person, or entity in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to determine whether a proposal will be made

## Article 21
Every person shall, without delay and without prior notice, freeze funds and economic resources that are owned or controlled by them, directly or indirectly, wholly or partially, as follows:
1. Any person classified under Article 12 of this Resolution by the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>, or acting on behalf of or at the direction of such person, or directly or indirectly controlled by them; or
2. Any person classified in accordance with any Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> resolution other than Resolution 1373, or acting on their behalf or at their direction, or directly or indirectly under their control.

## Article 22
The obligation to freeze stipulated in Article 21 extends to any funds and economic resources derived from or generated by the funds or economic resources referred to in paragraphs (1) or (2) of Article 21.

## Article 23
Without prejudice to the provisions of Chapter Six of this Resolution, it is prohibited for any person within the borders of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or any Kuwaiti citizen outside the country to provide or make available funds or economic resources to any listed person, or to provide financial services or related services for the benefit of a listed person, whether directly or indirectly, wholly or partially, or through an entity owned or controlled by them directly or indirectly, or acting at the direction of a listed person.
This prohibition does not include the addition of accrued interest on frozen accounts.

## Article 24
Every person implementing a freezing measure in accordance with Article 21 shall notify the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> within 24 hours of implementing the measure, and shall clarify the actions taken regarding those funds or economic resources, in compliance with the requirements of these procedures. Reporting obligations extend to any attempts to deal with the targeted funds or economic resources, and include the obligation to provide details on the nature and quantity of the frozen funds or economic resources, and any other information that may be relevant or facilitate compliance with these procedures. The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> will cooperate with the supervisory authority <orig>السلطة الرقابية</orig> or any other competent authority <orig>سلطة مختصة</orig> to verify the accuracy of the information provided.
<page_end>154</page_end>

# Chapter Six
## Lifting and Exceptions to Freezing Measures
### Article 25
Without prejudice to any other articles in this Ministerial Decision, any person may request the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> to lift or amend a freezing measure under Article 21. The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall initially decide whether to approve the request. In any case, the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> may only approve such a request if the applicant is not a person covered by Article 21, and if the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> is satisfied that the applicant is a bona fide third party unintentionally affected by the freezing measure. Decisions to amend or lift a freezing measure shall, in all cases, be limited to funds and economic resources that should not have been subject to freezing from the outset, for example, in the case of a confirmed false positive match.

### Article 26
Any person whose funds or economic resources have been frozen under Article 21, as well as any person affected by a freezing measure, may submit a written request to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> for authorization to partially or fully access the frozen funds or economic resources to cover the following expenses:
1.  Basic expenses, including expenses for foodstuffs, medicines and medical treatment, rent and mortgage payments, insurance premiums, and municipal service fees such as water, electricity, gas, and telecommunications, within reasonable limits;
2.  Professional fees and expenses associated with the preservation and maintenance, and those related to the provision of legal services, within reasonable limits;
3.  Fees or service costs for the management of frozen funds or economic resources.
In the case of funds and economic resources frozen pursuant to Security Council Resolution 1373 <orig>قرار مجلس الأمن 1373</orig> based on Article 21 (1), the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall primarily decide whether to approve this request.
In the case of funds and economic resources frozen under a relevant Security Council resolution other than Security Council Resolution No. 1373 <orig>قرار مجلس الأمن رقم 1373</orig> based on Article 21 (2), the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall notify the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> or its associated Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات</orig> of its intention to grant the request. Authorization may only be granted if the Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن</orig> or the United Nations Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات التابعة للأمم المتحدة</orig> does not object within 5 working days from the date of receipt of the notification from the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>.

### Article 27
Any person whose funds or economic resources are subject to freezing measures under Article 21 and any person affected by a freezing measure may submit a written request to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> for authorization to partially or fully access the frozen funds or economic resources to cover exceptional expenses.
In the case of funds and economic resources frozen under Security Council Resolution 1373 <orig>قرار مجلس الأمن 1373</orig> based on Article 21 (1), the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall primarily decide whether to approve this request.
In the case of funds and economic resources frozen under a relevant Security Council resolution other than Security Council Resolution No. 1373 <orig>قرار مجلس الأمن رقم 1373</orig> based on Article 21 (2), the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall notify the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> or its Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات</orig> of its intention to approve the request, and may only grant authorization after receiving explicit written approval from the United Nations Security Council <orig>مجلس الأمن التابع للأمم المتحدة</orig> or its Sanctions Committee <orig>لجنة العقوبات التابعة له</orig>.

### Article 28
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall decide on any request submitted under this Chapter within 30 days from the date of submission of the request.
The request shall be deemed rejected if the 30-day period expires without the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> issuing a response. The applicant may appeal the decision of the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>, whether through an effective decision by the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> or the expiration of the 30-day period, before the Special Court <orig>المحكمة الخاصة</orig> within 60 days from the date the applicant becomes aware of the decision. The decisions of the Court <orig>المحكمة</orig> shall be final.

### Article 29
In the event that any request under this Chapter is approved, the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> may include in its authorization any conditions and restrictions it deems necessary to prevent the use of funds and economic resources for the financing of terrorism or the financing of weapons of mass destruction.
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> may revoke the authorization issued under this Chapter at any time if facts indicate non-compliance with the imposed conditions or restrictions, or if the funds or economic resources subject to the authorization could be used, in whole or in part, for the financing of terrorism or the financing of weapons of mass destruction.

### Article 30
A freezing measure applied under Article 21 shall not prevent the addition of interest or other earnings due in accordance with a contract, agreement, or obligation that arose before the date on which the accounts became subject to the freezing measure, provided that such addition is immediately subject to freezing and the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> is informed thereof.
