Any decisions taken by the Special Committee under this chapter must be reported to the supervisory authorities, which in turn may inform the entities they oversee of any granted exceptions for access to frozen funds.

## Chapter Seven: Delisting Requests

### Article 31
Any person listed by the Special Committee pursuant to Article 12 may submit a written request to the Special Committee to revoke the listing decision. The Special Committee shall primarily decide on this request within 30 days from the date of submission of the complete request. The request shall be deemed rejected if the aforementioned period expires without a response being received. Any decision taken by the Special Committee, whether an actual decision by the Special Committee or by the expiry of the 30-day period, may be appealed before the courts within 60 days from the applicant's knowledge of the decision, provided that the court's decision shall be final.

### Article 32
The Special Committee shall delist any person pursuant to Article 12 if it determines that there are no longer any reasonable grounds to believe or suspect that the person meets the listing criteria. Freezing measures imposed on all frozen funds and economic resources shall be automatically lifted upon the Special Committee's publication of its delisting decision.

### Article 33
The Special Committee shall immediately notify all financial institutions (FIs), designated non-financial businesses and professions ("DNFBP"), supervisory authorities, and competent authorities of its decision to revoke the listing decision in accordance with Article 12.

### Article 34
Any person listed by a United Nations Sanctions Committee or the United Nations Security Council, who holds Kuwaiti nationality or has a place of business or residence in Kuwait, may submit a request for delisting to the Special Committee. The Special Committee shall decide whether to consider, based on available information, if the person meets the listing criteria stipulated in Article 18 of this Ministerial Resolution. If the Committee finds that the applicant does not meet the stipulated listing criteria, the Special Committee may submit a request for delisting to the United Nations Security Council or the relevant United Nations Sanctions Committee, as the case may be, and in line with the established procedures adopted by these Sanctions Committees. The listed person may also contact the Ombudsperson or the Focal Point directly. In such cases, the Special Committee shall facilitate the United Nations review in accordance with any applicable guidelines or procedures, including the guidelines or procedures of the Focal Point or the Ombudsperson, as the case may be.

## Chapter Eight
Special Obligations of Financial Institutions (FIs) and Designated Non-Financial Businesses and Professions ("DNFBP")

### Article 35
To implement the provisions of this Resolution, Financial Institutions (FIs) and Designated Non-Financial Businesses and Professions ("DNFBP") shall undertake the following:
1. Regular and continuous monitoring of changes and updates to the listing lists of the Special Committee, the United Nations Security Council, and Sanctions Committees, including through continuous follow-up of the United Nations Consolidated List of listed persons and the notifications of the Special Committee which are issued pursuant to Article 33 of this Ministerial Resolution.
2. Screening customer and beneficial owner databases, business relationships, and transactions against the names of listed persons regularly and in all cases immediately after any changes to the listing lists of the United Nations Security Council, Sanctions Committees, and the Special Committee.
3. Informing the Special Committee as soon as they know or suspect that a former or current customer, or any person they deal with or have dealt with in any way, or any person who has attempted to deal with them, is a listed person, or if they know or suspect that funds or economic resources are subject to a freezing measure under Article 21 of this Resolution.
4. Refraining from notifying or informing the listed person or any other third party of the intention to implement freezing measures before taking any freezing action.
5. Cooperating with the Special Committee in verifying the information provided.
6. Adopting and effectively implementing internal controls and procedures to ensure compliance with the obligations arising from this Ministerial Resolution.
7. Registering in the Special Committee's automated alert system.

### Article 36
The competent supervisory authorities, in coordination with the Special Committee, must verify the compliance of Financial Institutions (FIs) and Designated Non-Financial Businesses and Professions (DNFBPs) with the provisions of this Ministerial Resolution, and this includes, as part of their supervisory and field inspection activities:
a. Verifying that FIs and DNFBPs have and effectively implement internal controls and procedures to ensure full compliance with the obligations arising from this Resolution;
b. Verifying that FIs and DNFBPs have and effectively implement measures and systems for screening customer databases against listed names, and that the systems allow for the detection of customers and beneficial owners subject to targeted financial sanctions;
c. Determining whether and identifying cases recognized by FIs and DNFBPs where the customer or beneficial owner was a listed person or entity;
d. Determining whether any targeted properties have been identified and frozen by FIs and DNFBPs and whether the relevant reports have been submitted to the Special Committee in accordance with the requirements of these procedures;e.

Determining whether financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs) have policies and procedures prohibiting employees and officers from informing the client, beneficial owner, or any third party in advance that a freezing measure will be applied;
h. Submitting written reports on their supervisory findings to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> annually, except in cases of detecting violations where the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> must be notified immediately;
kh. Cooperating and providing information, upon request, to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>;

dh. Informing financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs) of any relevant decision issued by the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>;
r. Periodically reviewing the Committee's <orig>اللجنة</orig> website, as well as the United Nations website related to Security Council resolutions concerning combating the financing of terrorism and proliferation financing, in addition to all regional and international developments in this field, especially those related to the efficiency of the entity it represents.

### Article 37
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>, in coordination with the competent supervisory authorities and other stakeholders, shall guide financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions ("DNFBP") and the general public, providing them with instructions regarding their obligations and the method of implementing this Resolution. It shall also maintain an automated alert system to immediately inform financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions ("DNFBP") of any new additions or amendments to the listing lists under any relevant United Nations Security Council resolutions.

## Chapter Nine: Protection of Good Faith Actors
### Article 38
Any person, including any financial institution or designated non-financial business and profession ("DNFBP") or any person acting on its behalf, who in good faith freezes funds or economic resources, or refuses to allow their disposal or the provision of financial services in accordance with the provisions of this Resolution, shall be exempt from any criminal, civil, or administrative liability for any resulting loss or claim.

## Chapter Ten: Penalties for Violations
### Article 39
In cases where a financial institution or designated non-financial business and profession ("DNFBP") fails to comply with one of its obligations under Chapter Eight, the supervisory authorities may impose any of the penalties under Article 15 of the Law.

## Chapter Eleven: Case Study Group
### Article 40
To assist the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> in receiving and reviewing cases pursuant to Chapters Three and Four, a Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall be established under the supervision of the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig>. Its mission is to receive information, data, and intelligence reports from all possible local, regional, and international sources, and to analyze this intelligence to determine whether it relates to any person who may meet any of the listing criteria under Article 12, or relevant Security Council resolutions other than Security Council Resolution 1373.

### Article 41
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall consist of two operational experts from each of the authorities mentioned in Article 1 of this Ministerial Resolution.

### Article 42
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall actively request information and intelligence related to persons potentially subject to listing under Article 12, or any relevant Security Council resolution other than Resolution 1373, from local authorities, including intelligence and security authorities, as well as from foreign counterparts or regional or international initiatives related to the topics covered by the relevant Security Council resolution.

### Article 43
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall also receive all requests from foreign counterparts in accordance with Article 14.

### Article 44
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall analyze all intelligence presented to it, regardless of the method of receipt, and decide whether a recommendation should be submitted to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> for the listing of a person pursuant to Article 12, or to propose the listing of a person pursuant to Article 18 of this Resolution. The recommendation of the Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> is not binding but is used by the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> as a basis for its deliberations.

### Article 45
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall meet at least monthly, or within 24 hours of receiving any new intelligence or information that would lead it to urgently recommend the listing of a person.

### Article 46
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> shall submit a formal report to the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> after each meeting, including whether it recommends that the Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> list a person pursuant to Article 12, or that the United Nations list a person pursuant to Article 18.

# Article 47
The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> has the authority to collect and request any information from any public authority, person, or entity in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to determine whether the person meets the listing criteria in accordance with Article 12 or as stipulated in the annex of this Ministerial Decision <orig>القرار الوزاري</orig>. The Case Study Group <orig>مجموعة دراسة الحالات</orig> and its members may not notify any person subject to scrutiny that a recommendation for their listing is being considered.

## Chapter Twelve: Concluding Provisions
# Article 48
The Special Committee <orig>اللجنة الخاصة</orig> shall provide written notification of a listing decision or a decision to delist, pursuant to Article 12, as follows:
1. If the person is a resident of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, they must be notified directly, via email, or by any other available means.
2. If the person is not a resident of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, they must be notified through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> of the country in which the person resides.
3. If the person's whereabouts are unknown, notification shall be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> to the governmental representative of the country of which the person is a national.
4. The notification must include information that can be published and forms the basis for the listing decision or the delisting decision.

## Annex: Listing Criteria
### First - Listing Criteria pursuant to Security Council Resolutions 1267 (1999), 1988 (2011), and subsequent resolutions related to Al-Qaeda <orig>القاعدة</orig>:
- Any person or entity participating in the financing, planning, preparing, or perpetrating of acts or activities by, in conjunction with, under the name of, on behalf of, or in support of; supplying, selling or transferring arms and related materiel to; recruiting for; or otherwise supporting acts or activities of those individuals, groups, undertakings and entities associated with Taliban <orig>طالبان</orig> in constituting a threat to the peace, stability and security of Afghanistan; or
- Any undertaking owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by any person or entity identified pursuant to the paragraph above, or by persons acting on behalf of or at the direction of such persons or entities.

### Second - Listing Criteria pursuant to Security Council Resolutions 1267 (1999), 1988 (2011), and subsequent resolutions related to Taliban <orig>طالبان</orig>:
1. Any person or entity participating in the financing, planning, facilitating, preparing, or perpetrating of acts or activities by, in conjunction with, under the name of, on behalf of, or in support of; supplying, selling or transferring arms and related materiel to; recruiting for; or otherwise supporting acts or activities of those individuals, groups, undertakings and entities associated with Taliban <orig>طالبان</orig> in constituting a threat to the peace, stability and security of Afghanistan; or
2. Any undertaking owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by any person or entity identified pursuant to the paragraph above, or by persons acting on behalf of or at the direction of such persons or entities.

Article (First)
Clauses (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) of Article (85) of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. 81/1976 shall be amended to read as follows:

Issued for driving private cars with a passenger capacity not exceeding (7) passengers, transport vehicles with a load not exceeding (2) tons, and taxis.
Valid for Kuwaiti citizens and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> (GCC) countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaiti citizens, it is valid for a period of (5) years.
For illegal residents, according to the duration of the review card.
2- Public Driving License:
*   **Category (A)**: Issued for driving passenger transport vehicles with a capacity exceeding (25) passengers, shared transport vehicles, transport vehicles, tractors, trailers, and semi-trailers with a load exceeding (8) tons, vehicles transporting hazardous materials, and for teaching vehicle driving.
*   **Category (B)**: Issued for driving passenger transport vehicles with a passenger capacity exceeding (7) passengers up to (25) passengers, shared transport vehicles, and transport vehicles with a load exceeding (2) tons up to (8) tons.
The public driving license, in both its categories, is valid for Kuwaiti citizens and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> (GCC) countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaiti citizens, it is valid for a period of (5) years.
For illegal residents, according to the duration of the review card.
Holders of a public driving license Category (B) are not permitted to drive vehicles that a public driving license Category (A) allows to drive.
Provided that public driving licenses issued before the issuance of this decision remain valid until their expiry.

T.V).
Category (B): Issued for driving all types of motorized tricycles or vehicles with three wheels or more.
The motorcycle driving license, in both its categories, is valid for Kuwaitis and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaitis, it is valid for (5) years.
For illegal residents, according to the duration of the review card.
A holder of a Category (B) motorcycle driving license is not permitted to drive what a Category (A) motorcycle driving license allows to be driven.
Motorcycle driving licenses issued before the issuance of this decision shall remain valid until their expiry date.
4- Construction, Industrial, Agricultural, or Tractor Driving License:
Issued for driving all types of construction, industrial, agricultural vehicles, or tractors.
Valid for Kuwaitis and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaitis, it is valid for (5) years.
For illegal residents, according to the duration of the review card.
The provision of Article No. (92) of this decision must be observed for all types of driving licenses mentioned previously.
5- Special Activity Driving License:
Issued for driving all types of vehicles specific to the service activities defined in the license, and the type of activity is recorded therein.
Valid for Kuwaitis and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaitis, it is valid for (5) years.
For illegal residents, according to the duration of the review card.
This license shall be cancelled upon the change of the holder's profession to another profession or the cancellation of their residency in the country.
It is not permitted to drive it on public roads or in places unrelated to the service activities.
The procedures and fees applicable to private driving licenses shall apply to this license.

(Article Two)
The Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

- And based on the powers vested in us.
Decided
### Article One
The text of Article One of Ministerial Resolution No. (26) of 2021, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
"The electronic means by which electronic notification is valid shall be determined by any of the following:
1- The Hawiyati application <orig>تطبيق هويتي</orig> with the notified party, in accordance with the system approved by the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time of its receipt through the application's dedicated server, and in case of denial, the certificate issued by the Authority in this regard shall be relied upon.
2- The Sahel application <orig>تطبيق سهل</orig> with the notified party, in accordance with the system approved by the application's operating entity. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time of its receipt through the application's dedicated server, and in case of denial, the certificate issued by the application's operating entity in this regard shall be relied upon.
3- The Sahel Business application <orig>تطبيق سهل الأعمال</orig> (Business) with the notified party, in accordance with the system approved by the application's operating entity. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time of its receipt through the application's dedicated server, and in case of denial, the certificate issued by the application's operating entity in this regard shall be relied upon.
4- The email address of the notified party if registered with the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> and according to its latest update, or if previously proven at any stage of litigation. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time the server dedicated to this email receives the electronic message, and in case of denial, the certificate issued from the electronic records of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, based on the data of the notified party's email server, shall be relied upon.
5- The Web Service, in accordance with the system approved by the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> and the National Cybersecurity Center <orig>المركز الوطني للأمن السيبراني</orig>. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time the notifying entity receives the notification via the service, and in case of denial, the certificate issued by the notifying entity shall be relied upon.
6- Text messages (S.M.S) received on the mobile phone number of the notified party if registered with the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> and according to its latest update, or if previously proven at any stage of litigation. The notification shall be deemed to produce its effects from the date and time the notified party receives the text message, and in case of denial, the certificate issued by the service provider shall be relied upon.
Notification may also be made by any other electronic communication means specified by a decision issued by the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>."

### Article Two
Officials, each within their scope of competence, shall implement this decision. It shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force on the first day of the month following its issuance.

Minister of Justice
Counselor / Nasser Yousef Al-Sumait <orig>المستشار ناصر يوسف السميط</orig>

Corresponding to 9 March 2025 AD

# Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
## Resolution No. (55) of 2025
Director General of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
- Having reviewed Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And Resolution No. (502) of 2014 of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig> issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And Director General's Resolution No. (246) of 2017 regarding the system for registration and accreditation of investment companies and offices to submit applications on behalf of investors to the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>,
- And Resolution No. (118) of 2024 regarding the renewal of registration and accreditation of investment companies and offices accredited by the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> to submit applications on behalf of investors,
- And the recommendations of the One-Stop Shop Department <orig>إدارة النافذة الموحدة</orig> at the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> in its memo No. (2025/17) dated 2/3/2025,
- And for the public interest,

Has decided
### Article One
The registration of the companies and offices listed below in the register of investment companies and offices accredited by the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> to submit applications on behalf of investors shall be renewed for a period of one year from the date of issuance of the registration certificate:
1. Jibla Law and Legal Consultations <orig>جبله للمحاماة والاستشارات القانونية</orig>.
2. Strategic Brand Company for Business Project Consultations <orig>شركة استراتيجيك براند للاستشارات في المشاريع التجارية</orig>.
3. Al-Fahad and Partners Consultants and Lawyers, a Professional Law Firm <orig>شركة الفهد ومشاركوه مستشارون ومحامون شركة مهنية للمحاماة</orig>.
4. GLA & Company for Law and Legal Consultations <orig>شركة جي أل آيه اند كومباني للمحاماة والاستشارات القانونية</orig>.
5. Crowe Kuwait for Consultations <orig>شركة كرو كويت للاستشارات</orig>.
6. Al-Fulaijhan Legal Group <orig>مجموعة الفليحان القانونية</orig>.
7. Law Office of / Khalifa Hamed Al-Yaqout <orig>خليفة حامد الياقوت</orig> - Al-Yaqout and Al-Fawzan Legal Group <orig>مجموعة الياقوت والفوزان القانونية</orig>.
8. Law Office of Omar Khalid Al-Qahtani <orig>عمر خالد القحطاني</orig>.
9. Lawyer / Moudhi Hamad Al-Mousa <orig>موضي حمد الموسى</orig>.
10. Taher Legal Group Company for Law and Legal Consultations, a Professional Law Firm <orig>شركة مجموعة طاهر القانونية للمحاماة والاستشارات القانونية شركة مهنية للمحاماة</orig>.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Director General of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
Dr. Meshaal Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>
Issued on: March 5, 2025 AD

# Resolution No. (45) of 2025
Regarding the Renewal of Securities Activities License for Al-Waseet Financial Business Company <orig>الوسيط للأعمال المالية</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Securities Activities License Certificate for Al-Waseet Financial Business Company <orig>الوسيط للأعمال المالية</orig> No. (AP/2013/0013) issued on 28/06/2022;
- And the request of Al-Waseet Financial Business Company <orig>الوسيط للأعمال المالية</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has decided the following:
### Article One
Renewal of the securities activity license for Al-Waseet Financial Business Company <orig>الوسيط للأعمال المالية</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of a securities broker registered on the stock exchange.
This is for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 27/06/2025.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Head of Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: March 17, 2025 AD

# Decision No. 1 / 26 – R / 2025
## Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
Having reviewed Law No. (32) of 1968 concerning Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.
And Law No. (20) of 2014 concerning Electronic Transactions.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the tender No.: WA / 913/2024-2025 regarding the execution and organization of the "Here Kuwait" <orig>هنا الكويت</orig> celebration, marking 74 years since the official launch of the first broadcast of the State of Kuwait Radio <orig>إذاعة دولة الكويت</orig> and one year since the opening of Platform 51. This is in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website using the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 23/3/2025, for a fee of (50 K.D.) fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, non-refundable. Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – Ground Floor, inside sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid throughout the bid validity period of 90 days). The envelope must be sealed and bear the practice number as indicated above on the outside, while avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any indication thereof. The final deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 15/4/2025.
- The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Sunday, 6/4/2025, at 11:00 AM in the meeting room at the office of Mr./ Assistant Undersecretary for Radio Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد لشؤون الإذاعة</orig> – Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig>, Radio Building <orig>مبنى الإذاعة</orig> / Fourth Floor / to answer inquiries submitted regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or through a representative. Everything recorded in the meeting minutes shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all bidders before the bid closing date.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, 3 copies, except for:
  1. Bid form (paper copy)
  2. Initial security deposit (paper copy)
  3. Copy of the purchase receipt (paper copy)
  4. Bidder's data form (paper copy)
- The practice is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend the envelope opening session, after coordination with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date for the bid opening session.

### Announcement
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. 2024/2023/36 for civil maintenance works for all financial facility sites and their annexes in all departments of the Water Operation and Maintenance Sector <orig>قطاع تشغيل وصيانة المياه</orig> in various areas of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

Based on the request of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Maintenance Works</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender | Scheduled Date for Submission of Bids (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|:------|:---|:------|:--------|
| 2025-3-23 | 2025-4-22 | 1000 | 62,000 K.D. valid for 90 days in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

A preliminary meeting (inquiry session) will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, 06-04-2025, at the building of the Water Facilities Operation and Maintenance Department <orig>إدارة تشغيل وصيانة المنشآت المائية</orig> in Al-Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> area.

Tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for the bid submission deadline.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned cash payment must be made by certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must adhere to submitting them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified above in the table for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency will be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and preliminary insurance, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Non-divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file.
- regarding government contracts registered with the Authority concerning one of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session are entitled to do so.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the scheduled bid opening session and bring the following documents:
    1. Copy of the Civil ID.
    2. Copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
    3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be presented, authorizing whomever they deem fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.

<footer>
Before concluding, the Chairman of the Board of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> extended an invitation to the esteemed members of the Board to attend the next meeting.
The Agency's Board of Directors concluded its work at 11:30 AM.
</footer>

## Announcement

Further to the announcement published in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) on 23/2/2025 – Issue No. (1727) regarding the announcement of the aforementioned practice. Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Practice No. (KPA / 10 / 2024/2025) regarding the preparation of an economic feasibility study for the purchase of marine parts for Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig> ports, until Thursday, 27/3/2025, at 12:00 PM.

Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig>

# Tender Submission Requirements
The bidder must submit a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, ensuring to attach a copy of the tender on a flash drive, in accordance with the following conditions:
*   The technical envelope must contain the following:
    *   The preliminary bond in the form of a letter of guarantee for an amount of (K.D. 2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, unconditional, free from any reservations, and irrevocable, issued by one of the banks accredited in the State of Kuwait in its name and in favor of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This bond must be valid for at least three months from the last date for receiving tenders. Any tender not accompanied by the full bond will be excluded. Preliminary bonds may not be refunded until (90) ninety days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder submits the final bond and signs the contract, unless the practice is cancelled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this bond, and bidders are not permitted to seize its amount.
    *   General and special conditions and technical data for the submitted offer.
    *   Complete data on Kuwaiti <orig>كويتيين</orig> subcontractors (companies or individuals) who may be assigned part of the execution if the practice documents require it.
    *   Any other documents or data that may be required by the practice documents.
*   The financial envelope must contain the following:
    *   The tender form approved by the bidder.
    *   Price lists and quantity schedules.
    *   Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer in accordance with the tender conditions.
    *   Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.

## Preliminary Meeting Date
08/04/2025 at 10:00 AM in the 4th Floor meeting room

## Last Date for Submitting Tenders
Tender envelopes must be tightly sealed with red wax and deposited in the Internal Procurement Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء الداخلية</orig> box at the Financial Department of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> no later than 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 15/04/2025.

## Note
*   It is important to review the circulars related to the procurement practices of Kuwait Credit Bank's <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> Procurement Committee, available on the bank's official website, as they include general and specific circulars regarding public procurement systems.
*   The bank reserves the right to cancel the practice without stating reasons.
*   All documents must be valid.
*   Tender envelopes must be tightly sealed with red wax.

## Location
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> - Main Building, South Surra – Ministries Area – Plot 1, Parcel 900023, Tel No.: 1810000, 6th Floor.

## Review Hours
From (8:30) AM until (1:00) PM.

(K.D. 75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only – non-refundable –

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Thursday, 20/02/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> of the shareholders of Al-Dawli Invest Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> (K.S.C.C.) held its meeting at 11:00 AM on Thursday, 20/02/2025, at Crystal Tower Building – Sharq Area – Ahmed Al-Jaber Street – 25th Floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Anwar Jawad Boukhamseen <orig>أنور جواد بوخمسين</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> –
Attended by:
First: Shareholders representing – in person and by proxy – 450,000,000 shares, constituting 100% of the Company's total shares.
The meeting secretariat was handled by Mr. Ahmed Ashour Mohammed <orig>أحمد عاشور محمد</orig> – Compliance Manager and Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
After the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> announced the availability of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> in his capacity, Mr. Anwar Jawad Boukhamseen <orig>أنور جواد بوخمسين</orig> – Chairman of the Assembly <orig>رئيس الجمعية</orig> – opened the meeting, welcoming the esteemed shareholders and thanking them for attending.
Thereafter, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> proceeded to consider the items on the agenda and issued the following resolutions:
First: Approval of the amendment of the text of the following articles of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the Company as follows:
1- Approval of the amendment of Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the Company to become as follows:
Text of the Article before amendment
"Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning companies and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the Company was established are:
1- Investment Portfolio Manager, Activity Code 650210
2- Collective Investment Scheme Manager, Activity Code 650220
3- Investment Consulting, Activity Code 661904
4- Underwriter, Activity Code 650230
5- Custodian, Activity Code 650240
The Company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by proxy. The Company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities, provided that this is in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>."

## Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in birth and death records, the committee decided to make the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met

The Committee reviewed requests from number ((102)) to number ((114)) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death records for requests regarding omitted birth and death registrations. After its review and ensuring the completeness of documents and records, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement, no objection is submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

Against:
1- Ahmed Saiwan Ashwan Al-Shammari <orig>احمد صيوان عشوان الشمري</orig>.
2- Assistant Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Registration and Documentation Affairs.

- Property Description (according to the attached description certificate)
- Property Document No. 2007/21657 located in Granada <orig>غرناطة</orig> area - Plot (389), Block No. (2), Plan No. 31572, with an area of 779m², by public auction at a base price of K.D. 980,000 (Nine Hundred and Eighty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the description certificate:
** The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor and a roof, compliant with the license, previously registered under Plot No. 35, and currently registered as mentioned above.
** According to the expert's report
On 10/05/2023, the property subject of the lawsuit, located in Granada <orig>غرناطة</orig> area, Block 2, Street 209, Plot 35, House 133, Automated Number (16697439), was visited. The plaintiff's agent and her lawyer, with the assistance of Mr. Expert Khalid Al-Harbawi <orig>خالد الحربوي</orig>, inspected the property on site and estimated its value. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject of the lawsuit is a villa located on two streets (front and back). The property is a private residence consisting of two floors, ground and first. The exterior facades are Sigma, and the construction status is medium. It is a property separated into two parts, with an area of 779 square meters according to the document.
The plaintiff's agent pleaded before the expert with the parties to the lawsuit to enable the expert to inspect the property from the inside, but there was no response. The expert knocked on the door, but no one came out, making it impossible for the expert to inspect the property from the inside. The plaintiff's agent requested the expert to inspect the property from the outside and from the plan submitted for the expert session on 20/03/2023 (Attachment 5, Document 1). The plaintiff's agent affirmed that the plan matches the specifications of the property subject of the lawsuit. Accordingly, Mr. Expert decided that he could estimate the value of the property by inspecting it from the outside and reviewing the plan submitted to the expert.

- The expert was unable to inspect the first floor, as the first defendant stated that he did not possess the first floor and that its possessor is the plaintiff's son. He stated that the first floor consists of a hall, 3 rooms, a kitchen, and two bathrooms.
- The first defendant stated that he is the occupant and possessor of the ground floor, and that the first floor is allocated to the plaintiff by virtue of a spatial partition judgment, and that its current occupant is the plaintiff's son, and that the property is not leased to others and does not generate any income.
- The first defendant sufficed with what he had indicated.
- The expert inspected the subject of the dispute, and the consulted expert collected the necessary data to prepare his report.
- The expert sought the assistance of the expert from the administration to estimate the value of the buildings and constructions and the value of the land on which these buildings are located. The value of the buildings is K.D. 26,500 (Twenty-Six Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and the value of the land is K.D. 313,500 (Three Hundred Thirteen Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), making the total value of the land and the buildings thereon K.D. 340,000 (Three Hundred Forty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), as detailed in the expert's report attached to our present report.

## Property Description
The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a property separated into two distinct parts, with a secluded side entrance, and each building has a main entrance secluded from the outside. The first defendant's property is located on internal street No. 209, and the third defendant's property (brother of the first defendant) is located on the main street, as shown in the plan submitted by the plaintiff's agent and her lawyer, and is located on Khalid Abdul Nasser <orig>خالد عبد الناصر</orig> Street.
Internal property descriptions for the first defendant, internal street No. (209), according to the plan, consist of:
- Two floors: ground and first, and a roof
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a reception hall, a living room, three bedrooms with their bathrooms, three separate rooms, a preparatory kitchen, a main kitchen, and a guest bathroom.

## Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, after the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full one-fifth of the price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, he shall have the status of a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."

Secondly: Auction Terms:

The inspection was carried out as follows:
Disputed Property:

It is an old building with commercial finishing. The exterior facade is white Jordanian stone, and the air conditioning consists of units.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.

## Secondly: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

## Alert:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

** According to the expert's report
The disputed property located in Al-Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> area – Plot (2) – Street (107) – Avenue (9) – House (47), was inspected on site in preparation for its valuation, in the presence of the plaintiff personally, the first defendant personally and his representative. The inspection was carried out as follows:
*The disputed property is a government house, conforming in terms of general and specific specifications to document number (1976/6551) and has an area of (600m²). The property overlooks two streets, has 3 entrances, and is bordered by a neighbor on some sides only.
*The disputed property consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a courtyard, with the following details:
- The ground floor consists of an external diwaniya <orig>ديوان</orig> in the courtyard + an external storage room in the courtyard + an external bathroom in the courtyard + a large hall + a hall and a salon + 3 bedrooms + a maid's room + 3 bathrooms + a kitchen.

- The second floor consists of 4 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms.
- Air conditioning: units on the ground and first floors, central on the second floor.
- Flooring: ceramic.
- Walls: paint.
- Elevators: none.
- Exterior finishes: limestone.
- Stairs: there is one internal staircase and one external staircase serving the first and second floors.
- There is a setback in the house on the front facade of approximately 3 meters, and a large setback on the rear facade.
- The house is in a very old state of construction.
- There is a Kirby <orig>كيربي</orig> room on the roof.
- The expertise revealed from the on-site inspection that the property is not leased to others, but only the large room on the roof is leased.
- The plaintiff stated that the actual lessor of the property was his late father / Adhaib Kayyad Al-Dhafiri <orig>عذيب كياد الضفيري</orig> by virtue of sale contract document (1976/6551), and the beneficiary of only the ground floor and second floor of the property is the first defendant / Ahmed Adhaib Al-Dhafiri <orig>أحمد عذيب الضفيري</orig>.
- The first defendant stated that the property belongs to the deceased testator / Adhaib Kayyad Al-Dhafiri <orig>عذيب كياد الضفيري</orig>, and that the first defendant benefits from the second floor of the property, and the fifth defendant benefits from half of the first floor, and the defendants, and the rent of the large room, amounting to 30 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, is received by the fifth defendant since the death of the testator's mother, parties to the lawsuit, since 2021.
- Mr. Expert of Knowledge inspected the property in preparation for valuing the disputed property and the quarter for benefiting from the property since 2003, and submitting a special report for its sale in public auction.

# Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
1.  The auction shall start at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
3.  If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
4.  If the bidder deposits the price in the next session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
5.  If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the next session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
6.  In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and under their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
8.  The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

- The ground floor consists of a hall + external diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> + living room + bedroom + kitchen + storage room + laundry room + (3) bathrooms.
- The first floor consists of a living room + (5) bedrooms + kitchen + (3) bathrooms + maid's room.
5. The property is old.
6. The property is air-conditioned by unit air conditioning and does not have an electric elevator.
The expert inspected the property subject of the lawsuit and reviewed the case file and its documents in preparation for estimating the market value of the property and submitting his report thereon.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start with a basic price of 202,500 K.D. (Two Hundred Two Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Alert:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair rent."

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>
Announcement
The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of the announcement for Practice No. H.A./Sh.M.A. 95-2024/2025 <orig>هـ ع / ش م أ 95-2024/2025</orig> concerning the maintenance of data show devices for the Authority's colleges and institutes, according to the terms and specifications stated in the practice documents.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice should visit the official website of the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> (www.paaet.edu.kw) to purchase the practice tender document, listed under electronic services (general services), for a non-refundable fee of (KD 75). Bids must be submitted to the Authority's General Diwan <orig>ديوان عام الهيئة</orig> located in Shuwaikh Educational Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ التعليمية</orig> - Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig> within one week from this date.

Announcement

Any tender not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the preliminary guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be excluded.
- The tenderer must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority or any of the mentioned violations.
- as per Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector, and noting that any tender not including this certificate will be excluded.

- The practice is open to all companies and institutions specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders / Al-Jihaz Al-Markazi Lil-Munakasat Al-Amma <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance / Wizarat Al-Maliya <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), accompanied by the following:

  - 3- A written letter of authorized delegation with the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> and a copy of the signature authorization).
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their tender a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Care and Development / Al-Sunduq Al-Watani Li-Ri'ayat wa Tanmiyat Al-Mashru'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> confirming their project as small or medium.

- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as it is the right of interested companies to attend the envelope opening session, coordinated with the competent committee before the session date.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
- Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.

Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days starting from the date of opening the envelopes... The preliminary guarantee amounts to (5,170 K.D.) <orig>5,170 د.ك</orig>, provided that it is valid for the entire bid validity period and issued in the name of the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.

4. Valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate.

|:--|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | Tender No. 1-2025/2026 Operation, Maintenance, and Repair of Engineering Services at Sabah Al-Salem University City in Al-Shaddadiya <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية بالشدادية</orig> | 36 months | 3 months | Non-divisible / Lowest Price / No alternative offer allowed | Operation, maintenance, and repair of engineering services (air conditioning – electricity – plumbing – civil – mechanical – elevators – fire alarm and suppression) 24 hours / 7 days, with levels to maintain the readiness of buildings and laboratories for optimal use to serve the educational process | Sabah Al-Salem University City in Al-Shaddadiya <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية بالشدادية</orig> – for the Second Zone |

**Envelopes will be opened and the auction will be held after 12:00 PM on Wednesday, 2025/03/26, at Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> building, Financial Affairs Department – Second Floor.

### Announcement No. (38 / 2025 AD)
Redistribution of (54) Stalls in the Women's Market <orig>سوق الحريم</orig> in Al-Mubarakiya Markets <orig>أسواق المباركية</orig> Area
Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces to citizens the redistribution of (54) stalls in the Women's Market <orig>سوق الحريم</orig> in Al-Mubarakiya Markets <orig>أسواق المباركية</orig> area for exploitation only until the end of the current exploitation period, which will expire on 2025/7/31, in accordance with the terms and conditions stipulated in the Public Markets Regulation issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (2023/118). Those wishing to apply, who meet the terms and conditions, should submit their applications accompanied by supporting documents to the Food and Markets Control Department <orig>مراقبة الأغذية والأسواق</orig> at the Audit and Municipal Services Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة التدقيق ومتابعة الخدمات البلدية</orig>, Capital Municipality Branch <orig>فرع بلدية العاصمة</orig> in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> behind the Passports and Immigration Department <orig>إدارة الجوازات والهجرة</orig> during the period from: 2025/4/6 to: 2025/4/10 AD during official working hours. Applications submitted before this announcement or after the deadline for submission will not be considered. Please note that a public lottery draw will be held for those who meet the conditions on Monday, 2025/4/15 at 9:00 AM at the Municipal Markets Center of Al-Rai Area <orig>مركز بلدية أسواق منطقة الري</orig>. Applicants or their officially authorized representatives must be present, otherwise the draw will be conducted by the supervising committee without any liability.
Director General of the Municipality

Bid documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, 9/3/2025, and on subsequent days during official working hours from the Procurement Department's website at https://pur.ku.edu.kw after submitting the complete bid, sealed with the company's stamp, on a CD (3 copies), no later than 12:00 PM on Tuesday, 8/4/2025. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered. Bids will be opened publicly, subject to the submission of the following:

1.  The complete bid, sealed with the company's stamp, must be submitted on a CD (3 copies).
2.  The following documents must be submitted for each of:
    *   The original copy of the bid form and undertaking.
    *   The original sealed quotation.
    *   The purchase receipt from the website.
    *   A copy of the valid national labor percentage certificate.
    *   The envelope designated for the bid.
    *   Documents requested by the university in the bidding documents.
    *   The preliminary insurance of 2% of the bid value.
3.  The bid will be disqualified if the required documents are not attached.
4.  Bids must be placed in the designated box at the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> - Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig> (Al-Shaddadiya <orig>الشدادية</orig>) - Administrations Building <orig>مبنى الإدارات</orig> - Sixth Floor - Suppliers Affairs Section <orig>قسم شئون الموردين</orig>.

Note:
- Bids can be withdrawn by companies specialized in this field, provided they are registered with the University's Suppliers Affairs Section <orig>قسم شئون الموردين</orig>, from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM.
- The preliminary meeting will be held at the Nutrition Department <orig>إدارة التغذية</orig> - Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig> (Al-Shaddadiya <orig>الشدادية</orig>) - Administrations Building <orig>مبنى الإدارات</orig> - Sixth Floor.

In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Resolution No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulate that "economic within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication..."

Announcement
The General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the tender for the supply, installation, and welding of cables at National Guard camps, for Category (Two) of the classification (Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> - Electrical Works), in accordance with the conditions stated in the tender documents.
Therefore, companies wishing to participate in the tender must register on the website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the tender documents for a non-refundable amount of (1000 K.D.) one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only. Payment is made through the National Guard website using the (K-NET) service.
The preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 8/4/2025, at (10:00) AM at the headquarters of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> - Digital - Faisal Al-Jareed Building <orig>مبنى فيصل الجريد</orig>. Attendees, whether present or not, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications contained in the meeting. Participating companies must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw).
Note:
No single person or group of persons acting together may submit more than one bid in the tender, except for alternative bids if permitted by the tender conditions, in accordance with Article (29) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>.

For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999) extension 66734.

# Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>
## Announcement
The Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (PIFSS/25/2024/A) for the supply of hospitality items (juice-milk) for the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>. To purchase the practice documents and obtain the compact disc (C.D.) related to the practice, please visit the main headquarters of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> located in Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> area – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – or call telephone numbers (22994472 – 55538757).

1. The aforementioned cash payment must be made only via "K-Net" at the Institution's treasury.
2. Bids are to be submitted at the main headquarters of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> – Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> – in the bid box located on the ground floor. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM.
3. To submit any reservations or inquiries regarding the aforementioned practice, please send them to the following email address from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM, no later than Thursday, 27-3-2025. Requests submitted after this date will not be considered: Procurement@pifss.gov.kw
4. The right to attend the preliminary meeting – if any – is reserved for companies participating in the practice, provided they bring an official letter from the practitioner authorizing the representative to attend the meeting, a copy of their civil ID, and a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice document.
The following documents must be submitted when purchasing the practice documents:
1. An authorization letter from the company containing the name and civil ID number of the authorized person to purchase the practice documents.
2. A copy of the civil ID of the authorized person to purchase the practice documents.
Copies of the following documents must also be attached inside the bid envelope:
1. A recent copy of the company's license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
2. A recent copy of the registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. A recent copy of the certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
4. A recent clearance certificate stating no suspension codes on the practitioner's file with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
5. A certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
6. A copy of the company registration form in the Institution's register of suppliers, contractors, and vendors.
Director General by Assignment

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>
## Announcement
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (2-2025/2026) for the renewal of the Bank's **Power Builder** system licenses.
Interested parties wishing to submit their bids should refer to the Bank to purchase the terms and conditions booklet and technical specifications for the aforementioned practice, according to the details specified below:
> The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, while ensuring to attach a copy of the bid on a flash drive, in accordance with the following conditions:
>
> The technical envelope must contain the following:
> - The initial security deposit in the form of a letter of guarantee for an amount of (K.D. 2000/-) "only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>" unconditional, free of any reservations, and irrevocable, issued by one of the banks accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name and for the benefit of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This security must be valid for at least three months from the last date for receiving bids. Any bid not accompanied by the full security will be excluded. Initial securities may not be refunded until (90) ninety days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder submits the final security and signs the contract, unless the practice is cancelled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount.
> - General and special conditions and technical data of the submitted offer.
> - Complete data on sub-contracting companies or individuals who may be assigned part of the execution, if required by the practice documents.
> - Any other documents or data that may be required by the practice documents.
>
> The financial envelope must contain the following:
> - The bid form approved by the bidder.
> - Price lists and quantity schedules.
> - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer in accordance with the terms of the offering.
> - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.

### Statement and Circular

Regarding the email address approved by the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> for receiving or addressing all companies wishing to register with Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>.

The Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> alerts those concerned to the necessity of exercising caution when communicating with unknown parties impersonating an official capacity with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> and requesting confidential data pertaining to companies dealing with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>.
